wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Dona Helena Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

wine_desc: Crisp, tight and full of fruit, this is a lively apéritif style of wine from Vignobles Siozard. A tangy texture gives the wine great lift and adds to its drinkability. Drink now.
A touch of earthy peach appears on the nose. The palate repeats that earthy peach theme and adds some lemon freshness. This is aromatic, off dry and should be drunk while flavors are at their peak.

From the cru village of Boudes, this wine is now mature with its soft red fruits and juicy acidity creating a fruity refreshing wine. The wine, produced on the edge of France's central mountains comes from vineyards that are just a couple of mountain ranges away from Beaujolais in a direct line to the east.

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: This refreshing rosé, just slightly dilute, brings watermelon and strawberry with a touch of minerality. It's a blend of saignée and whole-cluster-pressed wine, aged half in steel and half in neutral wood.
wine_name: Fullerton 2016 Three Otters Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Given the popularity of the HBO series associated with this wine, it would sell like hot cakes no matter what it tastes like. Luckily, it's decent stuff, albeit a bit aggressive and youthful. Anjou pear, key lime, underripe guava and honeydew aromas lead into a sweet palate loaded with guava and bubblegum flavors. It finishes clean and very juicy.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is 63% Viognier and 37% Roussanne. High-toned aromas of candlewax, flower petal, green apple and herb lead to dry, acid-driven fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together but provides plenty of intrigue.
wine_name: Gård 2016 Freyja Lawrence Vineyards White (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is 80% Syrah, 10% Mourvèdre and 10% Grenache. It brings unusual aromas of sawdust, mushroom, Band Aid, dark fruit and spice. The palate is lush and full, showing warmth on the finish.
Bay leaf, mint and cedar notes open this soft, nondescript wine, which is somewhat flat in tone and style. Mocha and cola notes provide flavor.
This open, perfumed and fruity wine is crisp and bright. It also has a warm, apricot and ripe pear fruitiness that balances the citrus acidity. It's attractive now and ready to drink.
wine_name: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)

wine_desc: With its strong green olive aroma, this wine evolves into richly concentrated palate of anise, pineapple and pear, the fruit layered with vanilla. Light-bodied and supported by oak, it finishes bright.

appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: Nicely lean and not overly fruity, this medium-bodied wine has the typical firm tannins, leathery aromas and herbal flavors of the grape variety and makes a nice change of pace from the usual California menu of full-bodied, oaky concoctions.
Aromas of red raspberry and red cherry lead into flavors of pomegranate juice and cherry cola. The finish is pleasantly acidic and medium in length in this interesting blend of Pinot Noir and Syrah.
wine_name: Kovács Nimród 2012 Monopole Noir Pinot Noir-Syrah (Eger)

wine_desc: Ripe and fruity, this is a pale pink-colored wine from Raymond family organic vineyards. In the winery, the wine is full of red berry flavors and with a crisp final texture. Refreshing and lively, it's ready to drink now.
wine_name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Aromas of starched sheets and lanolin show a hint of apple. This feels rather lean and similar to soda: there isn't much body to it. Tropical melony flavors are oaky, and the finish turns downright woody and sweet like canned pineapple.
This Tempranillo's oaky berry aromas are solid but standard. It shows moderate buttery oak and plum flavors, tasting mostly of creamy oak on a finish propped up by acidity.
wine_name: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2014 Ea! Tempranillo (La Mancha)

wine_desc: A blend of 40% barrel fermented Pinot Bianco, 40% Friulano and 20%, Ribolla Gialla fermented in steel, this opens with aromas suggesting dried exotic fruit, coconut and oak-driven spice. The aromas carry over to the rather lean palate alongside a confectionery note and firm acidity. A walnut taste gives it a bitter finish.

Slightly smoky grilled-toast aromas lead into a plump medium-bodied wine filled with flavors of yellow plum, tangerine and lime. It's not particularly zesty or linear in a true cool-climate fashion, but steers clear of ripe tropical fruit, ending on a gentle note of citrus pith. Drink now.

This ruby-colored wine offers aromas of black cherry and notes of green pepper and summer farmstand. It has flavors of black cherry, cherry cola and cassis, with soft tannins and a bright burst of acidity in the finish.
wine_name: Minkov Brothers 2014 Le Photographe Cabernet Franc (Thracian Valley)

designation: Diccianove Marzo Pas Dosé Metodo Classico
wine_desc: Elegant and finely structured, this creamy, fragrant white opens with heady scents of jasmine, honeysuckle and white stone fruit. The smooth, delicious palate delivers green melon, white peach, cantaloupe, grapefruit and orange zest while a saline note lifts the lingering finish.
wine_name: Olivini 2010 Diccianove Marzo Pas Dosé Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

wine_desc: This standard Garnacha feels jammy but a bit shapeless. Its raspberry and cassis aromas are ripe and candied, with a floral note while its raspberry and plum flavors finish with modest spice.
This has intense aromas of chopped sage, mint and Mediterranean scrub. The herbaceous notes carry over to the fresh juicy palate along with Marasca cherry, raspberry and just a whisper of peppercorn.
wine_name: Produttori Vini Manduria 2016 AKA Primitivo Rosato (Salento)

wine_desc: In terms of price, this wine can be considered the entry-level wine for the increasing range of Douro wines form this famed Port estate. This wine is all about fruit—bright red fruits—and just a touch of spice and toast from the wood aging. Drink the wine from early 2018.
wine_name: Quinta do Noval 2015 Maria Mansa Red (Douro)

wine_desc: This is a young wood-aged wine with rich toast. While the toast does smother the fruit at the moment, there are enough crisp acidity and citrus flavors in the background to come through as the wine matures for another year or two. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

wine_desc: Leafy, slightly damp aromas include notes of spiced plum and herbs. On the palate, this is fairly stocky and chewy. A mixture of berry, spice and peppery flavors finishes with perceptible spicy oak.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Light aromas of lemon, apple, pineapple, toast and spice lead to just off-dry flavors. It drinks a little sweet for a brut but still delivers enjoyment—a straightforward crowd pleaser.
wine_name: 14 Hands NV Brut Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: The earthy berry and plum aromas in this full-bodied wine include cinnamon and spice notes. Its ripe black fruit comes with a tea-like note and a rubbery mouthfeel, finishing rugged with meaty black fruit and spice flavors.
Aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose while the crisp palate offers citrus peel and peach. Bright acidity gives it a clean refreshing finish.

A deep shade of reddish pink, this rich style of rosé shows red cherry, cola, crushed slate and chalky, orange pith-like aromas on the nose. Ripe plum and strawberry flavors mark the palate, kissed by star anise and plenty of acidic bite.
This refreshing wine from the Seze family of Fronsac is light, crisp and packed with fruit. Crisp with citrus flavors it is ready to drink now.
This concentrated, herbal wine has a good balance between the great fruit and the tangy, zesty texture. With its fruity character and spicy aftertaste, it's already a pleasure to drink.
wine_name: Château le Grand Verdus 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Baking spice and vanilla aromas are at the fore, followed by blue fruit and barrel spices. The barrel influence (71% new French and American) leads on the palate as well, with abundant vanilla flavors that wash over the fruit. There's some good fruit underneath, if you can get to it.
wine_name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Spicy cherry aromatics carry a touch of tack room leather. Those flavors follow, leading into drying tannins with a dash of dark chocolate. The wine seems a little confused about where it's heading, but it packs plenty of flavor at the moment. Drink up.

With 5% Viognier, this is a dense and layered wine sourced from a cool, coastal site off the Sonoma Coast and from the warmer Alexander Valley. It offers a strong taste of grilled meat and baked plum, finishing on violet and black pepper notes.
This wine has aromas of black berry, dried red raspberry and blueberry. In the mouth there are flavors of blueberry juice and black plum. The finish is slightly jammy yet persistent.

appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
wine_desc: The aromatics immediately catch your attention: an inviting mix of raspberry and tart citrus. The wine is tightly focused, with crisp edges around wild-berry flavors. Just a tiny hint of bloody beef moves it toward more Northern Rhône Syrah flavors.
wine_name: Sweet Cheeks 2013 Barrel Select Syrah (Southern Oregon)

wine_desc: Red berry, dried wild herb and yellow spring flower aromas mingle in the glass. The bright refreshing palate offers up juicy morello cherry and raspberry before closing on a tangy note.
Vivid herb and mineral aromas and equally vibrant citrus and herb flavors give this wine a bright personality. It has enough body and near-sweetness to match all that energy and find balance.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Merlot (32%), Sangiovese (31%) and Malbec (30%) make up the majority of this blend, with the balance Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Aromas of currant, plum and herb are followed by plump cherry flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins. It provides appeal and value.

On the nose, this aging Chardonnay brings corn to mind. Its palate is neither exciting nor flawed, with melon and stone fruit flavors that are yeasty and short, finishing on a bready and slightly oxidized note. Not a great value for its price.

This blend of Viognier, Roussane and Marsanne isn't typically Chilean but it doesn't smell or taste all that French, either. Tropical floral aromas are similar to bath oil, while this feels full, pulpy and oily. Peach and persimmon flavors finish distinctly salty, with an oily feel and flavor notes of citrus peel.
wine_name: Undurraga 2016 Sibaris Gran Reserva Viognier-Roussane-Marsanne White (Maule Valley)

wine_desc: Pay attention to the Tutiac winemakers north of Bordeaux, who have produced another good wine. Bright red fruits give it a crisp character, packed with acidity and lively fruitiness. It's a great summer apéritif wine. Drink now.
wine_name: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Carrelet d'Estuaire Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Subdued aromas of pressed acacia flower, hay and beeswax take shape in the glass. The mature palate offers ripe yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside a note of toasted almond. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Almost indistinguishable from an all-stainless Chardonnay, this nonetheless offers fine value and clean crisp flavors. The basics of simple white wine are here—green apple and tart lemon, served up fresh and immediately drinkable.
wine_name: Wine by Joe 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

wine_desc: Snappy grapefruit and tangerine aromas are clean and crisp. That also describes the palate on this Maule Valley SB. Fairly intense flavors of lemon-lime and grapefruit cruise across a racy, unbroken finish.

Briny stone fruit aromas lead to a pulpy palate in this medium-bodied wine. Its ripe white fruit flavors show no signs of oak, tasting melony and finishing short. Drink as soon as possible for best results.
This Monastrell's cherry and cassis aromas show a rough, oaky burn. It's grippy and a touch raw on the palate, with roasted berry and plum flavors that linger into the finish.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Deep black plum aromas are enhanced by soy and crushed graphite on the nose of this bottling. It lands on the palate softly, with tangy plum and turned loam flavors, its tannins sticky and persistent.

There is a touch of toastiness to this otherwise fruity wine, produced by Jean-René Matignon of Château Pichon Baron in Pauillac. It has class as well as attractive tangy acidity and a refreshing citrus backdrop. Drink now.

appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: This crisp and fruity wine is bright with tight apple and grapefruit flavors. It is cool, with a strongly mineral streak and considerable youthful acidity. This bottling will be better from 2018.
wine_name: Cave de Saumur NV De Chanceny Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: This wine is so colorful it almost glows. The bright pink hue is a clue to the vivid raspberry and strawberry flavors that follow, giving an almost sweet, candied effect on the palate and finish.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Sweet apple blossom scents combine with a botanical element on the nose of this bottling, which also offers a grassy note. The crisp palate offers lemongrass at first, opening into riper pear flesh flavor and finishing with a touch of salt and candied lime tang.
Crisp and taut, this Lobre family wine is on a tight rope. It balances between intense citrus acidity and riper apricot and pear favors. It will be better from late 2017.
Balanced acidity and fruit give this Lobre wine its immediate attraction. It has a bright character, the fruit and the acidity in harmony. Drink this ripe wine now.

Lightly herbal berry fruit aromas are nothing you haven't seen before. In the mouth, this Cabernet is choppy and showing bold acidity. Flavors of plum and currant are racy and a touch spicy, while this is scouring on the finish.
wine_name: Château Los Boldos 2015 Grande Réserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)

wine_desc: Crisp and fruity, this wine is full of apple and citrus flavors. It also features a touch of wood and spice, with a creamy aftertaste from the light wood aging. Drink now.
This is a tight, mineral-textured wine. Crisp fruit keeps it bright, but the texture adds a more serious, structured note. Wait until late 2017 for it to come completely together.

This full, foamy and aggressive sparkler gives off peach and nectarine aromas with an odd hint of scrambled egg. It's dry on the palate, with modest stone fruit flavors that turn bitter on the finish.
wine_name: Clos La Soleya NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

wine_desc: This quiet Albariño comes from the Vicente Gandia family of wines. It opens with short, peppery aromas backed by a medium-bodied palate. Peppery, slightly bitter flavors echo the nose, with a hint of stone fruit to help it along. Drink now.
Aromas of olive, mushroom and berry fruits are lightly herbal. This Cabernet feels scratchy, abrupt and edgy, while herbal raspberry and plum flavors finish solid and with a slight note of pickle.
wine_name: Concha y Toro 2015 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Privada Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

wine_desc: Aromas of toasted almond, white flower, dried herb and orchard fruit lead the way. It's round and fresh, with flavors evoking mature yellow apple, candied nectarine and a hint of thyme.
Aromas of honeysuckle, exotic fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub take center stage. The tangy palate offers grapefruit, peach and pineapple alongside crisp acidity.

The nose is very shy and just gives brief glimpses of pear fruit. The palate is a little dilute but has enough fruit to capture the appeal of pear-scented Pinot Gris. The body is rounded, has a pleasantly bitter edge and finishes dry.
wine_name: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Cuvée de l'Ours Pinot Gris (Alsace)

wine_desc: The nose is subdued but has a floral aspect. The palate, while fresh, slender and dry, seems to have a bitter element that gets in the way of the clean citrus notes. There is some concentration and a zesty lemony finish.
wine_name: Domaine G. Metz 2016 Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace)

wine_desc: This is a cool Pinot Noir with flavors both of red fruits and the wood aging. It is smooth with red-cherry fruit and gentle tannins and acidity. The wine, from vineyards on the slopes of Puy de Dôme mountains, is ripe and ready to drink.
wine_name: Domaine Sauvat 2014 Nymphéa Prestige Pinot Noir

wine_desc: Muddy, earthy notes enter the fruity fray of peach on the nose. The palate comes across as clean and zesty. The body is fresh, fruity and easy with an off-dry finish.
wine_name: Dopff & Irion 2016 Cuvée René Dopff Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Though labeled as Merlot, this smells more like Syrah which makes up 20% of the blend, with aromas of blue and purple fruit along with whiffs of smoked meat and dried herb. The fruit flavors are sweet and plump, backed by soft, luxurious tannins. It's enjoyable but doesn't seem varietally correct.

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Earthy but basic berry and plum flavors introduce this bumpy, rugged Tempranillo. Its tight mouthfeel is governed by rough tannins and tomato-like acidity, its lightly herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finishing choppy, rugged and abrasive.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is a blend of fruit from Gamache (65%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyards. Aromas of game, Band Aid and dried cherry are followed by lush, sweet fruit and savory flavors. There are some interesting things going on but the gaminess proves too distracting.
wine_name: Gamache 2013 Vineyard Select Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Soft black plum candied strawberry and molasses aromas show on the somewhat shy nose of this red blend. Light red fruit and a minty lift show on the palate, which is light bodied yet offers tannic firmness.
wine_name: Harmony Cellars NV Repertoire Red (Paso Robles)

wine_desc: This is a classic crisp apple-driven and fruity wine. With delicious acidity and a lively aftertaste, the wine is tangy and zesty and a great summer drink.
wine_name: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: Crisp and fruity, this wine is full of apple and citrus flavors. It also features a touch of wood and spice, with a creamy aftertaste from the light wood aging. Drink now.
This is a tight, mineral-textured wine. Crisp fruit keeps it bright, but the texture adds a more serious, structured note. Wait until late 2017 for it to come completely together.

This full, foamy and aggressive sparkler gives off peach and nectarine aromas with an odd hint of scrambled egg. It's dry on the palate, with modest stone fruit flavors that turn bitter on the finish.
wine_name: Clos La Soleya NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

wine_desc: This quiet Albariño comes from the Vicente Gandia family of wines. It opens with short, peppery aromas backed by a medium-bodied palate. Peppery, slightly bitter flavors echo the nose, with a hint of stone fruit to help it along. Drink now.
Aromas of olive, mushroom and berry fruits are lightly herbal. This Cabernet feels scratchy, abrupt and edgy, while herbal raspberry and plum flavors finish solid and with a slight note of pickle.
wine_name: Concha y Toro 2015 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Privada Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

wine_desc: This wine's suntan lotion aromas and mild volatility are a bit disconcerting. On the palate, it's full and dark, with abrasive, rubbery tannins and jammy currant and black cherry flavors that finish strong.
wine_name: Jardín de Lúculo 2015 Los Bohemios Garnacha (Navarra)

wine_desc: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon with 6% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot from several appellations within the Napa Valley is soft and smoothly textured, offering brawny black cherry and toasted wood flavors.
wine_name: Martin Ray 2014 Synthesis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: Aromas of lemon-lime, jasmine and honeysuckle prepare the palate for crisp, clean flavors of lemon zest and lemon curd.
wine_name: Minkov Brothers 2011 Le Photographe Rheinriesling Riesling (Thracian Valley)

wine_desc: This wayward wine shows yeasty aromas, generic red fruit and citrus flavors and a cleansing finish.
This wine is simply constructed, light bodied and fruit-forward, with a mix of red and black berry flavors. The fruit is well matched with graphite, wood, clove and leather notes.

appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas are barrel forward, with notes of char, vanilla, toast and sweet spice. The barrel notes continue on the palate, overwhelming the fruit almost completely. It's a shame as there's good things to be had underneath.
wine_name: Nodland 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

wine_desc: Round and friendly, this opens with aromas of banana and tropical fruit. The scents carry over to the ripe fruity palate along with yellow apple and a hint of lemon peel.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Black plum juice, black pepper, caramel and smoke mark the nose of this bottling, which is fairly light in color. It's thin in body yet offers familiar black cherry and herbal spice flavors.
The nose is very shy but the palate holds creamy candy-like strawberry notes. This is dry and fresh, light and easy. A touch of residual carbon dioxide makes for extra liveliness. Drink this soon.

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Oregon's recent overproduction of young Pinot Noir has opened the door for this easygoing, forward and fruity style. Clean and simple red fruits offer no subtle flavors—just a little boost to the finish from the supporting tannins.
This wine has enticing aromas of jasmine, white peach and orange blossom. It is well balanced with flavors of apricot and tangerine on the palate and a touch of bright orange flavor in the finish.

appellation: Rosé de Loire, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: This is a dry style of rosé. Packed with red currant and berry fruits, this blend of Cabernet Franc and Grolleau has a touch of spice to add extra interest. It is perfumed, crisp and ready to drink young.
wine_name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2016  Rosé de Loire

wine_desc: While there is ample pear fruit on nose and palate, bitter pith notes seem to be dominant. Alcoholic heat is palpable on the midpalate. The finish is dry and returns to the fruity pear notes.
wine_name: Domaine G. Metz 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

wine_desc: Briny grassy aromas are barely ripe and smell of match stick. This feels citric and more or less normal for a coastal SB. Pithy flavors of grapefruit skins blend with passion fruit in front of a juicy finish that tastes of white grapefruit and green herbs.
The 2009 vintage was a hot one, so this wine's stewy, overripe aromas and deep, advanced color aren't shocking. In the mouth, it's generous with raisiny, ripe berry fruit, feeling undeniably heavy.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas are light, with notes of potpourri, barrel spices, game and dark fruit. The black-cherry flavors are tart and puckering, also showing tannic grip. This wine seems disjointed at present.
wine_name: Gorman 2014 Black Curtain Reserve Syrah (Red Mountain)

wine_desc: Cherry-red in color, this rosé features aromas of cherry and white chocolate. It is surprisingly soft on the palate, with flavors of cherry, peach and citrus. Slightly chewy tannins make their presence known on a finish inflected with flavors of cranberry, thyme and sage.
wine_name: Gotsa Family Wines 2015 Dry Unfiltered Saperavi Rosé

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: This is a sharp-edged wine with green-tinged fruits—apples and pears not quite ripe. It pushes accents of herb and stem forward, and will probably drink best with food rather than on its own.
wine_name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Smoky toasty scents dominate this 50-50 blend of Tempranillo and Grenache. Firm purple fruits offer a taste of Spanish varietal character, with accents of bull's blood. This needs a bit more bottle age, which should continue to flesh out the finish.

Made with 75% Primitivo and 25% Aleatico, this has intense aromas suggesting white rose, crushed herb, Mediterranean scrub and wild berry. Mirroring the nose, the vibrant, easy-drinking palate offers sour cherry and orange zest alongside zesty acidity.

A relatively light-tasting wine from a sometimes heavy grape variety, this shows a mix of savory and fruit flavors, including cucumber, celery and white pepper. It tastes dry and almost austere, which is appealing in the right pairing, such as with goat cheese on toast.

Better known in the Douro, the Viosinho grape has found another home in the cool coastal Lisboa region. The wine is crisp, tangy and with a great zing of acidity. It is also fruity, full of apple and citrus flavors. Drink this attractive wine now.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This is a richer, rounder version of rosé, with tropical mango and pineapple notes as well as lush peach aspects. Moderate acidity keeps it grounded and refreshing.
wine_name: Balletto 2016 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: This is a soft easy-drinking blend of Cabernet, Shiraz, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Cherry, vanilla and hints of mint mingle easily on the nose and palate, which offers a medium body and a slightly creamy texture. Drink it over the next year or two.
This wine's heavy oak aromas are toasty but not overdone, while bacon and tobacco notes lurk in the background. Its raw, supremely tannic palate delivers woody, spicy berry flavors.

appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: This full-bodied and relatively pale-colored wine offers a pretty combination of light cherry, cinnamon and nutmeg flavors. A sweet-seeming ripeness adds to the luxurious texture. Firm acidity and a backdrop of fine-grained tannins balance it out and counter the richness beautifully.
wine_name: Maggy Hawk 2014 Stormin' Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas are generous, with notes of spice box, blue and purple fruit, pencil lead, barrel spice and vanilla. It's silky and sumptuous, showing a pleasing sense of texture and an extended finish.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This ripe, boldly made wine offers a rich tease of Dr Pepper that pleases the palate, before complex characteristics takes over. Black tea, forest floor, currant and spicy acidity are memorably interwoven with dense black fruit.
wine_name: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Mill Station Road Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Although not labeled as such, this is 98% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petit Verdot. Aromas of dried herb, black currant, pipe tobacco, cassis, black licorice and blackberry pie give way to pitch-black tightly wound fruit flavors. It shows exquisite concentration and richness, with enough acid and tannin to go the distance.
wine_name: Pirouette 2013 Vintage Select Solo Dancer Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_desc: This is a classic, concentrated but elegant wine, from the wonderful black cherry and forest underbrush aromas to the ripe fruit flavors, full body and polished texture. Aging in 30% new Hungarian barrels gave a subtle spicy accent.

This wine is firm with solid tannins. It has rich fruit and concentration with layers of blackberry and dark plums. It comes from a small seven-acre property and is aged for 15 months in wood. This impressive wine needs to age, so drink from 2022.
wine_name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2015 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)

wine_desc: This fragrant wine will entice with you its heady perfume of woodland berry, wild herb, graphite and blue flower. It's still quite young and tightly wound, delivering strawberry, cherry, white pepper and thyme wrapped up in taut tannins. Vibrant acidity provides balance and energy but give this time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: A very dark color and extremely concentrated fruit flavors give this dry and firmly tannic wine a lot of substance. It feels tightly wound, and will need time for the tannins to soften and let the tight, tart blackberry and bitter-chocolate flavors open up for more enjoyment. Known to age well for decades, this Concannon classic will be best from 2022.

appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: There's the ever-so-slight touch of pink to the glass in this bottling by Bruno D'Alfonso, who packs strong and fresh aromas of cider apples, chalk, tangerine zest, pear flesh and light jasmine on the nose. There is tons of energy on the palate, tightening up before unleashing poached Asian pear, lime spritzer and red apple flavors.
wine_name: Di Bruno 2016 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

wine_desc: Round and harmonious on the palate, this wine is a terrific value. Floral notes mark the nose, backed up by raspberry and strawberry fruit, while an undercurrent of crushed stone provides depth and backbone. the finish is berry-filled, but balanced and savory.

Unusually full-bodied and rich for a 2014, this is a big, muscular wine. The superripe plummy fruit is wrapped in a luxurious coat of chocolate-vanilla oak, yet finishes with drive to match its dusty tannins. Drink now–2025.
wine_name: Domaine de la Mordorée 2014 La Reine Des Bois Red (Lirac)

wine_desc: An aromatic touch of ivy plays alongside green pear on the nose. These aromas continue on the palate where they acquire a zesty, fresh edge reminiscent of grapefruit. A note of pepper joins on the slender, dry body. This is aromatic, light and very refreshing, with an invigorating, lip-smacking finish.

Red berry, leather and aromatic herb aromas slowly appear in the glass along with a subtle whiff of violet. The taut palate is still tightly wound, offering red cherry, cranberry and star anise alongside youthfully assertive fine-grained tannins that leave a firm finish.
wine_name: Fratelli Alessandria 2013 San Lorenzo di Verduno  (Barolo)

appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: There is a very accessible aromatic entry to this bottling. An almost-sweet touch of crystallized honey and beeswax is cut by green plum, wet stone and chopped lemongrass. The sip delivers rounded and pleasant flavors of nectarine, red apple and chamomile.
wine_name: Gainey 2015 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: From the heart of the Laguna de Santa Rosa, this vineyard-designate delights in rhubarb and strawberry, hugely pleasing in fresh fruitiness. Complexity builds in its salty undertones and bright, sharp teases of blood orange and lemon, while the backbone is strong in floral-driven minerality.
wine_name: Gary Farrell 2014 Martaella Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: Late disgorged, this wine combines 67% Pinot Noir and 33% Chardonnay from the vintage, exploding in well-honed, equal flavors of strawberry and white peach. Spicy acidity keeps it fresh and lively as it builds toward a dry, lemony finish.
wine_name: Gloria Ferrer 2008 Royal Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

wine_desc: A luxury white cuvée of pure Roussanne fermented in wood, this is full bodied, with an ripe, honeyed feel. Notes of toast and baking spices add complexity to the pear and pineapple flavors, lingering elegantly on the finish. Drink now–2021.
wine_name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2014 Domaine Grand Veneur La Fontaine Roussanne (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

wine_desc: Like most Tavels, this is a dark rosé, almost a light red rather than pink. It's full bodied and ripe without being overdone, boasting seductive notes of crushed stone, dried spices, dried flowers and red berries that finish with a mouthwatering squirt of lime juice.
wine_name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Le Crétacé  (Tavel)

appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Savory aromas of black pepper, leather and sandalwood provide depth to the core mulberry fruit on this clonal selection. Rounded flavors of black plums and dark berries are lifted by sagebrush, dried ginger and Christmas spice on the palate that offers layers and layers of depth.
wine_name: Alma Rosa 2015 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

wine_desc: The pure scent of freshly cut, ripe, green pear makes for a very appetizing, fruity nose. The palate adds a subtle white-pepper edge to this intense but juicily refreshing pear fruit. Green apple pops up, as well as bright and lively lemon. All this happens on a smooth and rounded body, full of charm but with a serious, savory core.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is a blend of 57% Syrah, 29% Grenache and 14% Mourvèdre. It brings the funk, along with notes of earth, grilled asparagus, stem, herb, bacon fat and green and black olive. The palate brings plenty of smoked meat and other savory flavors that glide on the warm finish. This wine offers a lot of quality and value. For those looking for a funky red wine, look no further.

appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Fat red cherries and red plums are laid across slate and star anise on the nose of this bottling based on a historic clone. There is solid tension to the sip, with rocky, grippy minerality framing hibiscus, pomegranate and chaparral flavors.
wine_name: Bargetto 2015 Mount Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_desc: Aromas suggesting ripe berry, espresso, pressed rose and a whiff of camphor slowly take shape. The palate is focused but still extremely tight, offering morello cherry, dried sage and a hint of dark spice alongside assertive close-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. Give the tannins several more years to unclench then drink.

Juicy and generous on the palate, this coastal wine is grown from Wente-clone grapes influenced greatly by their cool, foggy environment, showing a tightness of tension and acidity on the palate. Lemon peel and caramelized oak provide elegance and richness in equal measure.
wine_name: Boheme 2014 English Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

wine_desc: Wild berry, new leather, iris, dark spice and crushed herb aromas carry over to the elegant palate along with juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry, clove and white pepper. Firm fine-grained tannins and bright acidity lend balance and structure. Drink 2023–2035.
wine_name: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2013 Cannubi  (Barolo)

appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: The aromatics on this bottling are stunning, with elegant and fresh layers of violet, boysenberry and black raspberry. The sip is tightly woven and graceful, with tart black-raspberry fruit and white pepper leading into a lengthy finish that's supported by slow-rising tannins. This will evolve well in the years to come.
wine_name: Carucci 2014 Murmur Vineyard Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)

wine_desc: Espresso, toast, new leather, menthol and French oak aromas take center stage. The firm palate offers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, anise, roasted coffee bean, vanilla and sage alongside tightly knit fine-grained tannins.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas are quite reserved, with notes of cherry, herb, smoke and graphite. The black-fruit flavors, in contrast, are rich and full, bringing a sense of hedonism. It brings plenty of appeal now but should bring even more if the aromas open up.
wine_name: J. Bookwalter 2014 Protagonist Conner-Lee Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Restrained mulberry aromas interweave with scents of turned soil, white pepper and clove on the earthy nose of this bottling. The sip starts with a pleasing softness but quickly grows deeper and more weighty with luxurious tannins, showing hearty red cherry and dried fennel flavors.
wine_name: Lincourt 2014 Lindsay's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

wine_desc: A luscious nose of chocolate-covered cherries and black pepper start this delicious Kostifali from one of Crete's wine champions. On the palate, ample flavors of black cherry, cocoa and soft spices give the wine equal parts heft and finesse. This wine has more aging life in it but is excellent now.
Oak-heavy wood spice, plum and leather aromas open this Garnacha. On the palate, it's syrupy and heavy, with sweet cassis and blackberry flavors blanketed with oak, finishing jammy and resiny.
wine_name: Bodegas San Valero 2013 Particular Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)

wine_desc: Aromas of toast, oak and yellow flower lead the nose. Aged in large casks and barriques, the linear, if somewhat lean, palate offers golden apple and lemon zest alongside tangy acidity.
This stylish wine is tight, crisp and with fine intense acidity. Its apple fruitiness is bright, delicious and refreshing. With its lively aftertaste, this is ready to drink now.

Owner Michel Dietrich takes the vegan route with no animal derivatives in fining the wine. The wine is taut and tight, with a steely texture that needs to soften. All its fruit is there, muted by the herbal edge and nervy texture. Drink from late 2017.

Véronique Barthe is the first woman to manage the estate that has been in the Barthe family since 1789. She delivered a light and bright wine, poised and stylish with its crisp fruit and tangy acidity. A delicious burst of citrus at the end continues the theme of this fruity wine.
wine_name: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Balanced and crisply fruity, this refreshing wine has lively acidity and a tangy texture that brings out minerality. Drink now.

This has subdued scents suggesting grapefruit, citrus and a whiff of sun-warmed hay. Round and ripe, the palate offers yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of green melon alongside a note of dried sage.

Earthy spicy aromas of tea and leather frame herbal berry and cherry notes. This has a fresh jumpy palate and snappy flavors of spiced pie cherry, plum and oak-based vanilla. A bit of saltiness rises up on a juicy, racy finish.
wine_name: Cono Sur 2015 Reserva Especial Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

wine_desc: A sweet smell of honeysuckle and grapefruit candy permeates the nose of this bottling, along with cut honeydew melon and apple blossom. Sugary mandarin juice is the primary flavor on the palate, but it's properly offset by acidity a chalky texture.

A slightly earthy note colors the apple and lemon aromas on the nose. The palate shows lots of freshness and has a tart, light and dry body. The finish is lemony and fresh. Drink while aromas are expressive.

Aromas of wild flower and orchard fruit take center stage while the straightforward enjoyable palate offers ripe yellow pear and McIntosh apple. It's bright, with fresh acidity and a pleasantly bitter almond finish.

This blend of Syrah and Garnacha feels blocky and rubbery. Floral raspberry and blueberry aromas come with baking spice notes, particularly cinnamon. Ripe raspberry flavors finish with a dash of chocolate and a touch of salt.
wine_name: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Syrah-Grenache (Terra Alta)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas seem a bit disjointed on first pour, with notes of custard, citrus, mineral and spice. The palate is medium bodied, bringing some interest but not entirely pulling it all together.
Made with Nerello Mascalese, this has enticing scents of Spanish broom, red berry and Mediterranean brush. The lively palate offers cherry, orange zest and chopped herb alongside refreshing acidity.
wine_name: Le Casematte 2016 Rosematte Nerello Mascalese Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: An earthy, leathery aromatic character carries over to the palate of this wine, joined by ripe plum flavors. The blend here is 53% Mourvèdre and 47% Syrah, feeling full-bodied, firmly tannic and ready for cassoulet.

Straw-colored in the glass, this wine has aromas of white and yellow peach, with flavors of passion fruit and pineapple. It's amazing that it is more than 10 years old. The wine has good mouthfeel and is well balanced with a crisp, clean finish. Drink now or hold for a few years.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This collaboration from winemaker Austin Hope and Texas chef Tim Love starts with a crowd-pleasing—albeit sweet—nose, full of cherry sorbet and berry candy scents. The palate brings decent structure and offers plummy flavors.

Rubbery black-fruit aromas are heavily oaked, so much so that this Cabernet-Carmenère blend smells charred but also like plastic. A big grabby palate is jagged in feel, while this tastes like the nose suggests, meaning oaky, herbal and like berry fruits and plum. A woody finish is short on total integration.
wine_name: Montes 2015 Limited Selection Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Colchagua Costa)

wine_desc: Made with Negroamaro, this zesty rosé opens with aromas of red berry and Mediterranean brush. It's bright and juicy, with Marasca cherry, raspberry and hint of crushed aromatic herb flavors.

appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This steely, flinty, medium-bodied wine has spent no time in oak, allowing it to express its peach and pineapple fruit with purity and abundance.
wine_name: Pedroncelli 2016 East Side Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_desc: This is a warm ripe wine. Its generous texture and tannins are enveloped by the rich black fruits and acidity to give a mellifluous wine that will be ready to drink from early 2018.
This Crianza has leathery aromas, a tannic mouthfeel and roasted, spicy red berry flavors. It's dry, oaky and not particularly ripe.
This is a deliciously creamy wine with light white fruits and refreshing acidity. With its cool texture and minerality, it is crisp and zesty and ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta dos Murças 2016 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

wine_desc: For a Vinho Verde, this is smooth. With the a creamy texture along with bread fruit and lime flavors, the wine is soft. There is acidity to give a lift perfectly judged to keep this attractively crisp at the end. Drink now.
wine_name: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This is a juicy soft blend of Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet. Ripe red fruits dominate with balanced tannins and generous fruit. The acidity and the final burst of fruit show this easy wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Ribafreixo 2013 Pato Frio Red Edition Red (Alentejano)

wine_desc: After aging in bottle, this wood-aged wine has smoothed out to produce a rich wine with balanced fruit, acidity and toastiness. The wine does have plenty of spice from the wood, but it also has layers of citrus and pear-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.
wine_name: Ribafreixo 2014 Pato Frio Grand Escolha Antão Vaz (Alentejano)

wine_desc: The wine, a blend of Antão Vaz, Arinto and Siria, comes from Vidigueira, one of the cooler regions of the Alentejo. That gives the wine its crispness while also allowing it to have a ripe yellow-fruit character. With its spice and final crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of whole green pepper, hot spice, cherry and baking spice are followed by lighter styled, tart, silky-feeling fruit and barrel flavors.
wine_name: Tertulia 2013 Phinney Hill Vineyard Carmenère (Horse Heaven Hills)

appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Reticent dark fruit and licorice aromas are followed by tart fruit flavors and lightly bunched-up tannins. There's interest but it doesn't all seem to come together.
Light, smoky aromas and juicy, fruity flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. From a breezy delta vineyard, it's neither big nor overtly oaky but well-balanced and smooth in texture.

This light-colored, almost clear, SB opens with pungent, fairly sharp aromas of sea brine and sweaty citrus fruits. In the mouth, this is tight, edgy and pointy due to blazing acidity. Citrus, bell pepper and green-herb flavors finish peppery and with scouring acidity.
wine_name: Undurraga 2016 Sibaris Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

wine_desc: Medium straw in the glass, this wine has a nose of pineapple and white melon. Soft on the palate, it offers flavors of grapefruit, papaya and rose. Lingering brightness on the finish is bolstered by a hint of pear.
This opens with subtle aromas of wild flower and a whiff of exotic fruit. The bright fruity palate offers white peach, apple and a hint of honeydew melon. It's straightforward and refreshing.

This wine made from an aromatic indigenous Turkish grape offers a pleasing aroma of honeydew melon and freesia. It is soft on entry and remains smooth on the palate, with flavors of guava, pineapple and rose petal that meld into a soft floral finish.

In praise in the Loureiro grape, this dry wine has lively acidity while also having a ripe full texture of apples and pink grapefruit. The wine is crisp and intensely fruity. Drink now and until early 2018.
wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Maria Bonita Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This women-owned château above Cadillac produced a crisp wine, tight and nervy. With lively acidity, it focuses on the citrus side of life, finishing with a mineral edge. It will drink best from the end of 2017.

Apple flavors dominate this attractive blend of seven grapes, including three aromatic varieties, that give the wine its perfumed character. So although it is young and with enough acidity, it is the hints of lychee and peppered pear that add interest to the wine. Drink now.
wine_name: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

wine_desc: A little yeasty funk is all that appears on the nose. The palate has an edge of pithy bitterness that stands in contrast to the charming ripe pear that's boosted by a little residual sweetness. This seems a little out of joint but finishes dry with zesty grapefruit notes.

appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
wine_desc: Aromas of tropical fruit and banana lead the nose and carry over to the rounded palate along with pineapple and a hint of candied citrus. A note of bitter nut marks the close.

Light straw in color, this wine has a bright nose of pineapple and grapefruit. It fills the mouth with flavors of grapefruit and pineapple, with a touch of quince. The finish is a tad tart, with a pleasant note of passion fruit.

Medium straw in color, this wine has aromas of caramelized pineapple and Banana's Foster. It conveys flavors of tart apple cider and freshly sliced Honeycrisp apple. The finish is pleasantly acidic, with a bright splash of acidity in the post palate.
Yellow wild flower and ripe orchard fruit aromas lead the nose while the bright palate evokes tangerine, golden apple and a juicy hint of pineapple. Fresh acidity gives it a tangy finish.

appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: A buttery note tops the vivid cherry and blackberry flavors in this dry, straightforward, no-nonsense wine. Its fruitiness makes it attractive and fun to sip, while fine tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Petit Verdot (38%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Cabernet Sauvignon (26%), Merlot (12%), Cabernet Franc (12%) and Malbec. The aromas come off as leafy and green, with notes of dates, flowers and spice. The palate is quite light and elegant, not having the heft to stand on its own. The extraction seems dialed way back.

Apple skin and white peach flavors and a smooth, rather rich mouthfeel lend quite a bit of personality to this unusually low-alcohol wine. It tastes a touch sweet, or at least quite ripe, but is balanced by tangy acidity.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas are light, with notes of matchstick, herb and cherry. The cherry and plum flavors are sweet and generous, providing easy-drinking appeal.
wine_name: 14 Hands 2014 Limited Release Kentucky Derby Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_desc: A wine of moderate build and mouth-coating concentration, this shows a dusty plume of tannin and plum and soy flavors.
wine_name: Antler Hill 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Crisp pear, baked orange, sandalwood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. Sweet ripe peach permeates the palate, but a lemon wedge and savory sea salt sprinkling brings everything into balance.
Aromas of yellow stone fruit and banana lead the nose. Bright and straightforward, the palate offers green apple and a nectarine note alongside zesty acidity that gives it a refreshing finish.

Aromas of French oak, butter and a whiff of orchard fruit lead the nose. The oak sensations carry over to the palate along with yellow apple skin, lemon zest and a hint of sage. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
This wine offers aromas of lemon blossom, orange zest and honeysuckle. In the mouth, flavors of pear, apple and white peach precede a crisp finish.
This 100% Žilavka is medium straw colored and has aromas of lemon zest and dried Mediterranean herbs. Flavors of Bartlett pear, sage, and oregano lead to a tart but savory finish.
This is a juicy, supple, medium-bodied wine with toasted oak that presents as cedar, pencil shaving, planky wood and vanilla notes.
Green plums and attractive spice combine in this easygoing wine. Its acidity and bright aftertaste emphasize its dry character and its place at the table. Drink now.

The floral nose recalls bright dandelion and dried orange zest. The palate has a concentrated phenolic richness that adds a bitter, textured edge to this generous wine. The finish is off dry, fresh and zesty.

This is a well-proportioned, pleasantly balanced wine made from white Rhône grape varieties. It has plenty of fruit and a smooth, almost soft texture. Fresh apple and pear aromas meet nutmeg and vanilla flavors on the palate.

appellation: Muscadet Sèvre et Maine, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: This soft and fruity wine has open white fruit and citrus flavors. It is light and crisp with just the right amount of acidity. Coming from a warm year, it is richer than in other vintages, smoother and riper. Drink now.
wine_name: Chateau de l'Oiselinière 2015 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

wine_desc: This off-dry character is a hard style to work well. This wine succeeds because it has kept a dry background as well as strong minerality, so the almond-perfumed character of the wine is beautifully restrained and delicate. Drink the wine from 2019.
With big, fruity flavors, this is a ripe while also crisp wine. Delicious green and citrus fruits give plenty of acidity along with a sense of richness. Drink this wine now.
This full-bodied wine is rounded and soft. With generous red fruits, balanced acidity and a bright aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
Strongly herbal, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is fruity and crisp, with a good depth of flavor. Refreshing acidity adds a tight edge to this young wine. Drink from late 2017.
This is a dry wine, with hints of yeast as well as spice and nutmeg flavors. The fruit is well integrated into this mix of flavors, giving a ripe wine that is ready to drink.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This nose of this wine shy at first, before blackberry paste, hibiscus and cola aromas arise. It's medium-bodied on the palate, with bright blueberry, marjoram and black pepper flavors, bound together by prominent acidity.

Light and nutty, this combines a majority of Grenache with Zinfandel, Mourvèdre and Tempranillo. Fermented in stainless steel tanks, it maintains fresh acidity with its lightly ripe strawberry and watermelon fruit.
Fruity and fresh, this easygoing semidry Riesling offers heaps of sweet peach and citrus flavors. It's not complex, but is crisply balanced with a clean, refreshing finish. Drink now.

importer: Georgian House of Greater Washington, LLC
wine_desc: Aromas of green apple and white flowers prepare the palate for a wine that fills the mouth with soft fruit flavors, in particular apple, grapefruit and pineapple. The soft finish is marked by a note of Granny Smith apple.
Ripe and juicy, this offers aromas of pressed spring flower and yellow stone fruit. On the bright palate, a note of candied nectarine zest accents ripe yellow apple and dried apricot.

appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Big, bold and oaky, this wine smells like buttered toast and wood smoke, tastes rich but dry, and brings out pear, marzipan and pineapple flavors. It's full bodied and has a thick mouthfeel and lingering, smoky finish.

Intense acidity gives this wine character. It is taut and nervy, with a mineral texture. The bright, crisp red-fruit background to this acidity will assert itself over the coming months. Drink from late summer 2017.
wine_name: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Lalande Bellevue Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: This opens with aromas of wild berry, orchard fruit and a whiff of spring blossom. On the refreshing palate, bright acidity frames tangerine zest and wild raspberry. It finishes crisp and clean.

Solid berry aromas don't go crazy with the oak, spice or herbal components. A chunky pulpy palate is a bit soft, while peppery herbal animal notes comfortably work their way into core blackberry flavors. Flavors of herbal fruits and cured meats lend quality to the finish.
This Hungarian Blauburger is garnet in color, with aromas of cranberry, pomegranate and forest floor. It has flavors of sweet cherry and cranberry and a tart finish.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Bolstered by 14% Petite Sirah, this bottling offers a stunning array of herb and earth scents that surround a core of black plum and minty licorice spice. The palate shows rounded purple fruit and more herbal notes, and the acidity is strong but balanced.

Juicy and approachable, this blend of Riesling and Müller-Thurgau offers fleshy stone fruit and tangerine flavors brightened by soft, slightly yielding acidity. It's a pristinely fruity wine with just a touch of minerality on the finish. Drink now.

Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc, this friendly bottling offers perfumed oak and simple red fruit. Moderate in structure and body, with healthy fruit ripeness, it finishes with a cedar note.

Medium to full in weight and opulent in texture, this is a buttery creamy wine that reflects its South Australian origin. Broad and rich, it's a throwback to a previous generation's style of Chardonnay.
wine_name: Lambert 2014 A Thousand Words Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)

wine_desc: Plump, buttery aromas of apple and peach suggest popcorn. Typical of a Lapostolle Chardonnay, this feels a bit chunky and oily. Flavors of pineapple are slightly syrupy and oaky, while this tastes of honey, butter, stone fruits and mango on the finish.
This crisp, balanced wine has lively citrus fruits, light spiciness and some tight, mineral acidity. Drink now.
wine_name: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard
wine_desc: This Cab Franc bears a “cool climate” designation, and that's confirmed on the nose, which is highly herbal and green, with a blast of eucalyptus and juniper. A raw grabby underdeveloped palate tastes of leafy plum and berry fruits, while the finish feels scratchy due to drawing tannins.
wine_name: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Casablanca Valley)

wine_desc: Dusty raspberry and plum aromas show a note of Band-Aid. This feels creamy and full, with black cherry, chocolate and oak flavors. An oaky essence carries onto the finish, which is chunky and lasting.
wine_name: Montes 2015 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

appellation: Lake County, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: Very smooth and mouthfilling, this medium-bodied wine has a harmonious feeling about it. Ripe, juicy fruit and cola flavors meet soft tannins, and a broad, expansive texture carries them into the finish.
wine_name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2013 Reserve Sangiovese (Lake County)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Barrel notes dominate, with aromas of vanilla, pencil lead and coconut shavings out in front of purple fruit that's struggling to get to the surface. The palate is tart and elegantly styled, but the wood takes over the show.

This opens with subtle aromas of white spring flower, red berry and a whiff of toast that carry over to the rather lean palate along with notes of sour cherry, pomegranate and a hint of oak. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
Perfumed and bright, this is an attractive blend that includes Pinot Noir and Syrah. With its ripe creamy texture and exuberant red fruits, the wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)

wine_desc: The wine is attractive with its ripe apple flavors and shot of lemon. It is off dry, with a fruity character that makes it a great apéritif wine. Drink now.

appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: The floral aromas in this animated wine give way to fragrant fruit salad flavors that range from orange to pineapple to apple. It has a nicely tart texture and lingering fruity finish.

designation: Araucano Reserva Made With Organic Grapes
wine_desc: Saline aromas, celery notes and mild citrus scents make up the nose on this slightly round SB. Herbal green-fruit flavors finish with controlled pyrazinic bitterness.
wine_name: François Lurton 2016 Araucano Reserva Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Lolol Valley)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This aromatically unusual wine, with notes of cocoa and green herb, seems to show some oxidation. The purple fruit and orange-peel flavors are on the lighter side of medium bodied, pulling up on the finish.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
designation: Vineyard Select Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
wine_desc: Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc each make up 50% of this blend. The aromas are forward, with notes of matchstick, smoke, herb, char and game. The flavors are lighter in style, with game and herb influences throughout that distract.
wine_name: Gamache 2013 Vineyard Select Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

wine_desc: Butterscotch, lemon peel and a faint flinty quality show on the nose of this bottling from the Chalone team. Tangy mandarin flavors meet almond butter, honeysuckle and gunmetal touches on the palate.

This wine's melon and mango aromas come with an oily note of lanolin. It feels lazy on the palate, with just enough acidity to maintain freshness. Mild tropical fruit flavors turn yeasty on its hollow finish. Drink immediately.

Both nose and palate display a contrast between rounded ripe pear fruit augmented by residual sweetness and a rather bitter, pithy and phenolic edge. There is freshness here, but heat, too. It seems out of balance.
wine_name: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Lieu-Dit Altenbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

wine_desc: This is a pleasant, rather light-tasting wine with attractive, fresh raspberry aromas, red cherry flavors and good acidity to balance out the ripe fruitiness.

This wine from Southern Moldova is aged six months in oak barrels, which give it a creamy texture. There are aromas of apple and orange flowers, and flavors of lemon pith and Granny Smith apple juice.
The wine is dominated by perfumed Malvasia. That gives the wine its deliciously scented apples and pears. The texture—lightly mineral—adds a piquancy to this ready-to-drink wine.
wine_name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)

appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Finished dry, this combines elements of orange peel and citrus in a simple refreshing style.

Fresh easy notes of pear drop rise from the glass. The very slender palate has lemony freshness but also residual sweetness and a pithy phenolic edge. This is fresh, off dry and just balanced. Drink soon.
wine_name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

wine_desc: The nose suggests freshly cut Russet pear peel. The palate, slightly dilute, has a bitter edge and expresses just a little of that ripe pear suggested on the nose. Freshness helps the wine to finish dry. Drink soon while aromas hold.
wine_name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Découverte Pinot Gris (Alsace)

wine_desc: This attractively crisp wine packed with red berry fruits is light and lively. It offers plenty of acidity along with a touch of pepper and cinnamon. Drink now.

designation: Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion Blanc
wine_desc: This wine from Maison Ginestet is all crisp, green fruit. Light and bright, it bursts with acidity and perfumed fruitiness. Drink now.
wine_name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2016 Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: This wine is soft and rounded. It does have plenty of acidity but that is only a part of a ripe, smooth whole. The lemon fruitiness and touch of spice give the aftertaste a great lift.
Light and bright, this is a perfumed wine. Its very present acidity is underpinned by spice, red-currant fruits and a tangy, tangerine aftertaste. Drink now.
wine_name: Château le Grand Verdus 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Lightly aged in oak for four months, this is a fruity wine, with its blackberries and attractive acidity. The tannins and the hints of wood are really a fine supporting act that give the wine shape. Drink this accessible wine now.

Herbal plum and olive aromas come with dry spicy oak notes. All in all, this holds up well on the palate, which offers herbal spicy plum flavors. A minty finish with a black-olive character doesn't hinder this easy drinker.
wine_name: Santa Alicia 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Carmenère (Maipo Valley)

wine_desc: Plum aromas are a bit herbal and leafy. This is fresh and fairly well balanced for value-priced Carmenère. Flavors of herbal berry fruits and oak are basic but good, while this tastes minty, spicy and mildly oaky on an early exiting finish.
wine_name: Santa Ema 2016 Select Terroir Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

wine_desc: Mild peach aromas are honeyed, with an oaky note of vanilla. This is melony and plump on the palate, with just enough acidity to create balance. Mild flavors of melon and white fruits are largely generic, while this tastes yeasty, oaky and a touch buttery on the finish.

This 100% Vranac is garnet in color, with aromas of black cherry and black plum. It conveys flavors of fresh cherry juice and freshly sliced black plum, with a touch of pleasant astringency in the finish.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Orange peel and raspberry aromas meet a touch of sourness on the nose of this bottling from Joey Tensley and Alex Guarachi, which comes after the label's more successful red and white wines. The palate maintains good acidity and grip, with berry compote and earthy flavors.

appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Not a lot of rosé comes out of this appellation. Light bronze in color, this wine brings vibrant aromas of flowers, cherry, green pepper and fresh herb. The flavors are light, dry and crisp, almost at times seeming a bit sour.
wine_name: Three Rivers 2016 Cabernet Franc Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

wine_desc: Herbal briny aromas of black olive and roasted black fruits lead to a choppy raw palate. This tastes of herbal berry fruits and olive, with a touch of eucalyptus. Rubbery dry tannins result in scratchiness on the finish.
wine_name: Tres Palacios 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

wine_desc: Gritty leather and cherry aromas pass quickly across the nose of this wine. It's chunky and meaty, with plum, berry and herbal flavors. A grippy, straightforward finish confirms it's well made but has limits.

Mild volatility and dry herbal scratchy aromas of nondescript berry fruits lead to a somewhat soft palate. Flavors of generic berry fruits and chocolate finish ripe and chunky, with leftover notes of chocolate.
wine_name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2015 Riscos de Puquillay Alto Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This pale pink to slightly orange rosé shows tangerine, cantaloupe, cherry and sand aromas on the somewhat muddled nose. It's light in texture and a little flat on the palate but presents enjoyable squeezed lemon and watermelon flavors.

appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
wine_desc: This is made from a majority of Petit Verdot with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Dusty sage and raspberry notes form waves of big flavor and tannin, the fruit modest.
wine_name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Midnight Red (Oak Knoll District)

wine_desc: Inky color and intense leather, chocolate and smoke notes provide context and character to this inexpensive offering, which finishes with ripe, jammy blackberry and brown sugar flavors.
wine_name: Noble Tree 2014 Wicker Sham Ranch Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

wine_desc: This wine is ripe and smooth, with some spicy red-currant fruits. The delicious, crisp aftertaste is full of fruit, with a lightly yeasty character. Drink now.
wine_name: Quai de la Lune 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Half-and-half Alvarinho and Trajadura, the wine is dry, crisp and with just a touch of fizz. Grapefruit and lemon flavors mingle with softer apples to give a bright and lively wine that is just made for summer food. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Aromas das Castas Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: Ripe peach on the nose has some earthy undertones. The palate is fresh but has the same earthy and slightly muddy aspect. Lemon freshness brightens the flavors and creates subtle balance. Drink soon.

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: A dark purple color and reduced, funky stewed fruit and leather aromas open this tannic, hard-bodied Tempranillo. Its mix of tea and stewed berry flavors finishes rough, with a meaty note.

Aromas of oak, underbrush and a whiff of wet stone lift out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the lean palate along with ripe yellow-apple skin, a hint of citrus zest and a saline note. It closes on a bitter nutty note.
This opens with bold but faintly chemical berry aromas. Its chunky palate features hard tannins, tasting of roasted berries, oak and cured meat. On the finish, it feels rubbery and a touch flat.

A coming together of nearly equal parts Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller additions of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, this shows a confectionary streak of cherry-vanilla, its fruitiness offset by dry, dense tannins and cedar-tinged oak.

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Sharp-edged aromas show classic notes of grass and fresh asparagus. In the mouth, it pulls the fruit forward: there are lightly honeyed flavors of melon and peach with a slightly sugary, short finish.

appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: This is a ripe wine, shot through with acidity but also with softer pear and ripe apple flavors. It is tangy, made to be drunk young and fruity with a bright, celebratory aftertaste.
wine_name: Cave de Saumur NV La Petite Marquise Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

wine_desc: This rich wine has plenty of spicy fruit and a tangy texture. With attractive nutmeg flavors and light touch of tannin, it's definitely a food wine. Drink now.
High acidity marks this wine, giving it a crisp character with subdued fruitiness. That should change over the next few months, so drink from late 2017.
Although initially the acidity seems high, the fruit and the texture give the Dourthe wine balance. With a touch of spice, the wine is food friendly and ready to drink.
wine_name: Château Pey la Tour 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Blended with a splash of Grenache Blanc, this white is floral, viscous and full of a nutty character. It's the first vintage in which the producer has included grapes from Catie's Corner.

appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: Tartness and moderate tannins lend plenty of mouth-puckering grip to this medium-bodied wine, and that tartness comes off as a touch of raspberry vinegar on the palate. It has an appealing earthy, iron-like quality and a definite textural bite.

A fresh nose of green apple leads to flavors of Seville orange, white peach and tart white cherry. Soft on the palate, this wine may be a little tart for some tastes, but it is truly refreshing, with a burst of floral brightness on the finish.

Dusty spice and resiny oak aromas sit on top of pedestrian apple, pear and melon notes. This Chardonnay from a complicated, rainy vintage feels round and chunky, and sort of oily. Oaky peach flavors finish with little but barrel spice.

Vegan friendly and made with organic grapes, this fresh informal rosé has subtle aromas of red berry, wild flower and a whiff of tilled soil. The easygoing palate offers sour cherry and a hint of dried sage.
wine_name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2016 Purato Organic Wine Rosé (Terre Siciliane)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Unctuous and bold with toasted oak flavor, this wine shines with layers of ripe, round pineapple and pear flavor.
wine_name: Folie à Deux 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of herb, macerated cherries, toast, flowers and a strong Band Aid note are followed by sleek cherry and game flavors that narrowtoward the finish.
wine_name: Gamache 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_desc: There is an attractive spiciness to this clean warm wine. White currants and acidity add to the approachability of a wine that is ready to drink.
wine_name: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Branco White (Alentejano)

wine_desc: The wine brings out a strongly herbal, tangy character in this perfumed grape. With spice and intense acidity, the wine is still young, still with a closed character. This needs to be drunk from late 2017 or even 2018.
This solid, well-made wine has pleasant apple and pear flavors, light herbal accents, medium body and a smooth texture.

appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Muted stone fruit and melon flavors mark this vineyard designate, framed by a steely, simple texture and punctuated by bright sparks of orange and lemon peel.
wine_name: Kokomo 2016 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_desc: Subdued aromas of yellow flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of nut lift out of the glass. The palate seems rather evolved, offering suggestions dried citrus zest and a hint of baked yellow apple. It closes on a bitter almond note.

appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
wine_desc: In a ripe Bordeaux year, Sauvignon Blanc goes towards tropical and yellow fruits, making it ripe while also light and crisp. This refreshing, rounded wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château les Jouberts Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
wine_desc: Delicate aromas of wild flower and orchard fruit come together on this. Bright and enjoyable, the fresh, simple palate offers suggestions of peach, apple and lemon alongside crisp acidity.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot, 9% Petite Sirah, 4% Barbera and 3% Petit Verdot is fun, bright and herb-powered—perfect for a day at the beach, perhaps with a slight chill. Dried bell pepper and red berry aromas lead to a palate filled with pasilla chile and more juicy but light red fruit.

appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Toast, Bosc pear, spice, lees and flower aromas are followed by a sleekly styled palate. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
wine_name: Noviello 2015 French Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

wine_desc: This is an improvement over recent vintages, but still a bit vegetal on the nose, with aromas of canned beans or peas blending with citrus notes. A slightly oily mouthfeel frames briny citrus and tarragon flavors.

This pink Garnacha feels good and plump yet lacks the concentration of a great rosé. It has cherry Lifesaver, vitamin and cheese-like aromas and yeasty citrus flavors that are mild through the finish.
wine_name: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Edición Rosa Rosado (Navarra)

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: This everyday Tempranillo opens with spicy aromas and herbal black plum and prune notes. Its palate is ruled by rubbery tannins, tasting of berries, plums and mild oak spice. A roasted flavor closes the finish.

appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: This is a good, middle-of-the-road, unoaked wine. It has moderate fruit concentration, medium body, a nice balance and a crisp sense of freshness.
Made from 20% of each major red Bordeaux variety, this wine is rich with cedar, resin and a ripe plum notes. Tart acidity offsets the fruitier aspects, dotted with black pepper and leather flavors.
wine_name: Soquel Vineyards 2014 Intreccio Library Selection Red (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: Woody and dry with tannin, this wine shows sizable oak and body and generously ripe cassis and cherry flavors. Sage and cedar notes play off the fruit.
wine_name: Three 2013 Suscol Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: This opens with aromas of Spanish broom and wild berry. On the fresh easygoing palate, zesty acidity supports juicy red cherry and black raspberry. A nectarine note gives it a tangy close.
wine_name: Tommasi 2016 Masseria Surani Helios Negroamaro Rosato (Puglia)

wine_desc: Dusty gritty citrus aromas are briny and piercing. This feels honest and solid, but cutting. Grassy flavors blend with lean citrus notes prior to a basic short finish.
wine_name: Viña Casablanca 2016 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

wine_desc: A light fragrant blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Cão, the wine is soft with plenty of strawberry fruitiness and acidity. The aftertaste has a great lift of perfumed crispness.
wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Rosé (Tejo)

wine_desc: This is an unusual view of the red Castelão grape, here vinified as a white wine with no skin color at all. Some wood aging adds spice and roundness to what is a smooth, while toasty, wine. Its white fruit and acidity are joined by some tannins. So this wine needs a few more months. Drink from early 2018.
wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Pegos Claros Branco Castelão (Península de Setúbal)

wine_desc: Neutral aromas and a light pink color suggest this will be an easy ride. Its shy palate is light on acidity, with generic, mild flavors and a mildly briny finish.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of pear, lees, herb and spice lead to a medium-bodied palate. Some bitter notes provide a bit of distraction.
wine_name: Board Track Racer 2015 The Vincent White Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_desc: This is a solid Verdejo, with citrusy acidity and pulp to the palate. It shows modest melon and apple aromas and citrus and green herb flavors that finish with no major changes.
wine_name: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Colorea Verdejo (La Mancha)

wine_desc: Cherry and blackberry aromas come with spice and cool note of cola in this Monatrell-Syrah blend. It's narrow and tannic, with black fruit and desert herb flavors that finish dry and rubbery.
This red blend offers aromas of black cherry, dried plum and dried cherry. Flavors of red and black plums come with a touch of dark chocolate in the finish.
wine_name: Bostavan 2015 Dor Rara Neagra-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Moldova)

wine_desc: This rich, concentrated wine shows mountain-like aromas and flavors, such as dried herb and sage. Blackberry, blueberry and dark chocolate round out the full-bodied picture.
wine_name: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 603 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: There is a crisp spring in this wine— light and bright with great acidity and a touch of sweetness. It has a light prickle on the tongue that adds to the liveliness of this attractive wine.
wine_name: Casca Wines 2016 Bote Branco White (Vinho Verde)

appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: Ripe and sweet blackberry jam and dried fig flavors fill out this Port-style sweet wine. Good doses of tannin and acidity keep it structured enough to not feel cloying, lending a little textural grip.
This is a very easy light-bodied red for chilling. The body is dry, slender and fresh. The flavor expression is of red fruit, earth and apple skin. It has a rustic, picnic-style quality. Drink soon.
This wine is spicy, fruity and packed with herbal and lemon flavors. It will soon be a refreshing wine, lively and with swathes of acidity. Drink from late summer 2017.
Crisp and tightly fruity, this wine is bright and suffused with a lively streak of acidity. It dances with fruitiness and just a touch of spice. Drink this wine now.
wine_name: Château de Seguin 2016 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: The spice of this wine shows most. Add that to its good acidity and lively texture, and the wine will be delicious and rounded in a few months time. Drink from late 2017.
