An attractive pale, salmon-pink-colored wine, this is soft and ripe with strawberries and a smooth texture. Drink now.
Soft, ripe and fruity, this lightly spicy wine is full of red fruits and crisp acidity. It balances between the fruit and the tangy, textured aftertaste. Drink now.
Bright and easy drinking, this has delicate aromas of yellow wild flower and a whiff of pear. It's fresh and simple, offering yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside crisp acidity.
Very fruity, ripe-tasting and rounded, this medium-bodied wine is easy to swallow due to its low acidity and soft texture. Hints of butter and nutmeg add to the fresh apple flavors.
This bright-pink medium-sweet wine is crisp, bright and with a clean soft texture. Light, lively and with an easy line in wild strawberry flavors, the wine is immediately ready to drink.
wine_name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2016  Rosé d'Anjou

wine_desc: This ripe fruity wine is bursting with young red fruits. It has a fine structure that gives a core of dryness. It also has a crisp edge that brings out the fruit and the liveliness of this attractive wine. Ready to drink now.
Taut and with its youthful acidity still up front, this wine has good potential. Its crisp acidity and lively, bright character all promise well. Drink from late 2017.
This mild, plump and basic Chardonnay leads with peach blossom, yeast and cured ham scents. Its melon, peach and apricot flavors hollow out on a mild, yeasty tasting finish.

Not quite as bold as its name suggests, this wine is well-balanced and fun to sip. Fruity and medium-bodied, it smells like raspberries and rhubarb, tastes like red cherries and feels nicely full on the palate, bolstered by a hearty dose of fine tannins.
wine_name: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California)

wine_desc: With its delicate onion-peel color and rather subdued aromas, this rosato appears older than it is. The palate is a bit more expressive and slightly fresher, offering suggestions of tart apple and sour cherry before finishing on a bitter note.
Chocolate-covered strawberry meets rich brown sugar and cola notes in this medium-bodied wine that's moderately structured and round. It finishes in a plume of subtle smoky oak.
wine_name: Frei Brothers 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

wine_desc: Aromas of acacia, mature apple, hazelnut and an unusual balsamic note lead the nose. The palate is already evolved and has lost most of its fruit richness and freshness, offering instead honeyed mineral, toasted nut and a hint of dried citrus peel.

Berry and plum aromas are creamy and spicy while hinting at prune. This everyday Cabernet feels creamy and a touch flat and soupy. Plum and berry flavors are slightly weedy, while this holds steady on a chunky finish.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This is a great project dedicated to and featuring the winery's workers, who are named on the bottles, although the wine itself is a tad sweet. Baked black cherry, licorice and caramel aromas lead to a palate ripe with purple berry and cocoa dust flavors. An easy to quaff and light-bodied red.

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Maybe released just a little too soon, this cuts off its tart rhubarb and raspberry flavors with stiff hard tannins. They bring the flavors to a quick halt, leaving just an impression of stemmy earth.
The spice of this wine shows most. Add that to its good acidity and lively texture, and the wine will be delicious and rounded in a few months time. Drink from late 2017.
An attractive pale, salmon-pink-colored wine, this is soft and ripe with strawberries and a smooth texture. Drink now.
Soft, ripe and fruity, this lightly spicy wine is full of red fruits and crisp acidity. It balances between the fruit and the tangy, textured aftertaste. Drink now.

This is a generous blend of Antão Vaz, Roupeiro and Perrum (aka Pedro Ximenez). It is finely perfumed, full of juicy white fruits that are shot through with lemon juice. This is a wine to drink young and now.
wine_name: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)

appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This is a stiff, tannic wine with wood smoke and tart cherry flavors and a firm, mouth-puckering texture that persists on the finish. It leads with a lush blackberry jam aroma but then closes in and tightens up.
wine_name: Kivelstadt Cellars 2014 Father's Watch Red (North Coast)

wine_desc: Aromas of cookie dough, cassis and chocolate set up a wide palate with choppy tannins. Herbal flavors of currant and red plum are more tart and snappy than the nose indicates, while this tastes briary and a bit woody on the finish.
wine_name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2015 Don Feli Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: A dark and brooding exploration of black fruit with soft edges, this wine shows generous smoky oak and cinnamon notes, along with an unexpected streak of egg cream.
Prominent oak and butter aromas and flavors give this medium-bodied wine a sweet impression, and its mouthfeel is smooth and soft. It smells like caramel and tastes like pears.
Slightly oily, gritty aromas display some but not a lot of citrus essence. This is a tightly wound SB with briny lime and tart kiwi flavors. A fresh snappy finish tastes of high-acid citrus fruits.
wine_name: Viña Maipo 2016 Vitral Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)

wine_desc: In the spirit that Tejo can grow anything on its fertile soil, this wine is a rounded tropical-fruit-flavored Sauvignon Blanc. It has acidity enough as well as a warm smooth character. It is certainly ready to drink.
wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

wine_desc: This blocky Tempranillo smells dense and damp, with curry and earthy berry notes. Its chunky palate deals in heavy berry flavors that are low on elegance and high on tannin, and its finish is earthy and flat.
wine_name: Yemanueva 2014 La Tercia Bodega Tempranillo (La Mancha)

wine_desc: Grapefruit spiciness and fruit is promised on the nose. The palate does not quite keep the zesty promise, diluting that freshness a little. But there is enough focus to take this to a dry fresh finish.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas of plum and blue fruit bring appeal but don't seem entirely varietal. Flavors are sweet, backed by lightly tacky-feeling tannins. It delivers easy-drinking enjoyment, though characteristics of the variety seems hard to find.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Concentrated blackberry and blueberry flavors are lifted by hints of fennel and smoke on the nose of this bottling. The first impression on the palate is thick cherry syrup, but a definitive structure and prominent acidity emerge to brighten the experience.
This is a really refreshing style of rosé. Its fruity raspberry and red-currant flavors are shot through with fine acidity and a lively crisp aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.
wine_name: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Rosé (Alentejano)

wine_desc: This is a balanced blend of Rabo de Ovelha and Roupeiro grapes. They give the wine both its crisp acidity and its ripe white-fruit flavors. The acidity and the texture suggest the wine should age for a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
wine_name: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Vila Santa Branco White (Alentejano)

wine_desc: Fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel, this fun, approachable wine is ready for the beach or picnic grounds. Round and easygoing on the palate, it shows tart apple, lime and lemongrass flavors.
This semisweet wine has a flowery bouquet of jasmine and citrus blossom. The florality continues to the palate, combining with flavors of pineapple, ginger and apricot before a slightly sweet finish.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Candied apple, cantaloupe, plumeria and bubblegum touches show on the nose of this ripe blend of 39% Marsanne, 38% Roussanne and 23% Grenache Blanc. There are strong tropical notes on the palate, including guava, coconut oil and tuberose flavors.

appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This wine has an unctuous nose that shows jasmine, plumeria, coconut and ripe apple scents most prominently. Ripe mango, coconut and banana touches show on the palate, which is clean but quite tropical.

This wine's creamy, woody maple and tobacco aromas are within Rioja norms. On the palate, it's blocky and thick, with vanilla and marshmallow flavors that taste sweet, finishing with little structure.
wine_name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Puerta Vieja Crianza Selección  (Rioja)

wine_desc: This rich, fruity wine is supple and soft on the palate, with deep mocha and blueberry flavors. From vineyards in Coombsville and Conn Valley, it's full bodied and densely packed.
wine_name: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 602 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
wine_desc: This is a rounded smooth wine. It does have a crisp edge of red currants and acidity but the main flavor comes from the ripe red-berry fruits and touch of caramel. Drink the wine now.
wine_name: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

wine_desc: With just a hint of a pink color, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Citrus, tangerine and lemon flavors carry a light touch of red currants. Drink this bright wine now.
This Bobal's dark, earthy berry and leather aromas are closed but presentable. On the palate, herbal plum, tomato and lightly baked berry flavors finish with the scrub of rustic tannins.
Hard aromas of road tar and herbal berry fruits are the definition of gritty. Leafy dry red-fruit flavors are light on ripeness, while this is spicy tasting and drawing on the finish.

If almond Danish came in liquid form, this wine would be it. The aromas suggest vanilla, toasted almond and cream while the flavors are equally pastry-like, with a sweet touch. The texture is soft and smooth.

Principally Syrah, with 6% Viognier (presumably cofermented), this is sourced from a vineyard planted by Patty Green. Some good grapes go into this wine, but it has emerged with an off-putting sweaty aroma that carries into the flavors. Apart from that there is thin cranberry fruit along with notes of lemon and unsalted peanuts.
wine_name: Matello 2013 Fool's Journey Deux Vert Vineyard Red

wine_desc: Bold yellow-gold in color, this aged, barrel-fermented Verdejo has predictably heavy aromas of wood spice and resin, joined by hints of carrot juice and apricot. It has solid palate with adequate acidity, showing oaky stone fruit flavors that finish with a heavy dose of barrel spice.

With 50% of Arinto in the blend, this is rounder and richer in taste than many Vinhos Verdes. It does also have a crisp edge that comes from the citrus tang. The general effect is bright while full in the mouth from the delicious fruit. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta da Raza 2016 Raza Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Honeyed crème brûlée flavor is the highlight of this salty, moderately structured wine that's fairly priced and simple in its approach.
This wine's nectarine, mango and citrus aromas are mild. It has a solid mouthfeel that suggests proper balance. Apple, green banana and tropical fruit flavors finish short and low on acid.
wine_name: Raventós de Alella 2015 Tina 9 Pansa Blanca (Alella)

wine_desc: Overripe stewy aromas of tomato, baked beans and raisin raise a red flag of caution. Following the nose, this Cabernet Sauvignon blend feels a bit flat and baked. Cooked, herbal berry and plum flavors finish chunky, with savory flavor notes of herbs and oak.

importer: Georgian House of Greater Washington, LLC
wine_desc: Deep blush in the glass, this wine has aromas of white peach and rose petal. It is full in the mouth, with flavors of nectarine, clementine and lavender. Soft floral notes enhance the bright finish.

appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Rather grapey, front-loaded flavors move quickly into a subdued midpalate, with muted notes of ash and licorice. The wine seems a bit thin given its fairly high alcohol.

appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: There's a curious and compelling saline quality to the nose of this widely available, well-priced bottling, reminiscent of a kelp-lined seashore. It's underscored by Anjou pear, underripe orange and flint scents while a faint hay flavor meets warmer nectarine elements on the easygoing palate.
wine_name: Tangent 2015 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

wine_desc: Fruity and fresh, this has aromas of red berry and pomegranate. The scents flow through to the easygoing palate along with raspberry and bright acidity.
wine_name: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Molino a Vento Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

wine_desc: Crisp and packed with acidity, this wine needs time to soften and fill out. Hints of riper fruits lie underneath, and also a touch of perfume. Drink from late 2017.
wine_name: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Lalande Bellevue  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: Leafy cherry and tire-rubber aromas fairly represent the variety. This Limarí Pinot feels chunky and medium full in body, but fresh. Salty rubbery plum flavors finish about the same, with a hint of residual salt.
wine_name: Viña Tabalí 2014 Vetas Blancas Reserva Especial Pinot Noir (Limarí Valley)

wine_desc: Light, pleasant apple aromas are about all this neutral Chardonnay is giving. Its mild palate with just enough acidity carries clean and easy melon flavors. A slightly briny note closes out the lean finish.
This red blend from Hungary is garnet in color with aromas of cranberry and black cherry. Flavors suggest tart cherry and pomegranate juice, with grippy tannins and an acidic finish.

appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Contemporary Grenache Blanc expressions lean tight and bright, but this bottling takes an extremely tropical approach, showing honeydew, banana cream and bubblegum on the nose. It's restrained upon first sip before overpowering tropical waves take hold. A well-made wine, it will find fans who crave this flowery style.

Cherry, cassis, tomato sauce and crushed leaves are the aromas on this rubbery-feeling Carmenère. Spiced cherry flavors don't show much depth or complexity, while this feels dry and tastes lightly oaky on the finish.
Fresh earthy notes join the subtle peach fruit on the nose. The palate counters with slightly bitter notes that seem slightly out of joint. Drink this while aromas are fresh.

With vineyards south of the Michelin tire city of Clermont-Ferrand, this producer is on the edge of the volcanoes of the Puy de Dôme. The wine, lightly fruity with fresh wild-berry flavors, is soft and fruity, ready to drink young. Just wait until early 2018.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Iron-laced beef aromas meet boysenberry and wet stone on the nose of this widely available and smartly priced wine from the historic producer. Red cherry fruit shows on the palate along with a touch of turned earth, making for a pleasant yet simple sip.
Approachable, ripe and round, this white celebrates full-figured baked apple and crème brûlée notions, with additional vanilla notes.
wine_name: Geyser Peak 2014 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

wine_desc: Aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose on this bright straightforward white. It's simple but well made, with flavors of yellow peach and a hint of dried herb alongside crisp acidity.
Smoky oak and extracted tannin give this wine girth and concentration, as earthy compost, tobacco, black cherry and woody oak flavors mingle on the full-bodied palate.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Stainless steel-fermented and aged, this cloudy white offers a spritzy acidity and steely texture. Fig, flint, grass and lemon flavors highlight its light-bodied imprint.

Pithy zesty notes rise from the glass. The palate has the same lifted, pithy, and slightly bitter edge but some residual sweetness rounds the pear apparent on the palate into fluid fruitiness. The bitter edge remains and the wine finishes dry.

This scattershot red is made from the Garnacha Peluda grape. It's airy on the nose, with cherry and citrus peel aromas that are also slightly foxy. There's not a lot to the palate, aside from medicinal red berry, salt and rubberband notes. It's light in body yet fiery and aggressive on the finish.
Delicate scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose while the fresh light-bodied palate offers suggestions of yellow peach and apple. It closes crisp and clean.
Cedar and resin notes rise to the fore in this full-bodied wine that's basic and hearty, with blackberry and dried herb flavors.
wine_name: Benessere 2014 Estate St. Helena Highway Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

wine_desc: Aromas of sweat and sea water are more pyrazine-based than fruity. This is racy and sharp in feel, with briny salty flavors of lemon and green herbs. Throughout, this cutting SB is more salty tasting than fruity.
wine_name: Calcu 2016 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

wine_desc: This dusty, tannic wine from the Oak Knoll District is rich with cedar, graphite and herb notes that complement its black cherry fruit.
wine_name: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 601 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: Pear drop and strawberry make for a fresh inviting nose. The palate is slightly dilute but very fresh and lively with some residual carbon dioxide. This is light and dry. Drink while aromas are fresh.
wine_name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Alsace)

wine_desc: This is a fruity wine with a off-dry character that is balanced by lime and lemon fruitiness. The acidity and the tangy herbal character give the wine an attractive bite. Drink now.
wine_name: Caves Velhas NV Lagosta White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This is a warm wine, ripe and with hints of yellow fruits as well as crisper acidity. Poised between herbal and riper flavors, it's ready to drink now.
This attractive pink-colored wine has plenty of red-fruit flavor and acidity. It is a warm, rich wine, full of fruit with a touch of spice. Drink now.
wine_name: Château Laville 2016 Rosé de Laville Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Pascal Sirat named this wine for his father and his son. Bright and fruity, it is already deliciously light, refreshing and bright. Acidity jumps out of the glass, giving a crisp, fresh character. The aftertaste is more taut and tense. Drink now.
wine_name: Château Panchille 2016 Blanc de Fernand  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: This wine is fruity, packed with red-berry flavors. It has plenty of the acidity that marks this vintage in rosés while keeping a riper backdrop. Drink now.
wine_name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Les Hauts de Smith Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: From vineyards on the slope above Cadillac, this is a tight, mineral-textured wine. With crisp lemon flavors, it is brightly lit with acidity and clean fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.

With 20% Sémillon in the blend, this wine has some richness as well as plenty of herbal character. It is light, refreshing and crisp, with plenty of acidity and gooseberry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Cheval Quancard 2016 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: This is a spicy, herbal wine. Its crisp lemon flavor is lifted by perfumed Muscadelle in the blend to give a wine that has a warm edge to balance the acidity. It is ready to drink.

Picked on the early side, this is a lean, tight expression of what can be a plump endearing variety. Melon and fresh herbs turn grapefruit as the wine progresses across the palate, finishing tart and crisp. Drink now.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of flowers, purple fruit and baking spice are followed by a vanilla-filled palate, with the tannins showing a touch of astringency. The vanilla barrel influence takes over the show, especially on the finish. It's a shame as there are good things going on underneath.
This blend, with 50% Touriga Nacional, is deliciously crisp while also ripe. It has a softly tannic texture that gives it a zesty character. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.
A mix of lemon and melon aromas comes before a lightly oaked medium-bodied palate. Oak-based flavors are more obvious than fruit-related ones, while this has a resiny oaky character on the finish.
Grass and apricot scents define the nose of this lively, refreshing wine—a simple study in vanilla and ripely sweetened peach that was fermented entirely in stainless steel tanks.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas are quite reticent, with notes of herb, purple fruit and abundant wood spices. Still, the palate delivers plush-feeling fruit flavors, speckled with attractive barrel accents.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas in this wine are light, with notes of herb, citrus and orange peel. The palate is dry and broad, with tart citrus flavors. Although appealing, it seems a bit generic.
wine_name: Zero One Vintners 2015 Copper Lily Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_desc: Flinty and austere in tone, this reserve-tier wine is lemony and tart, with grapefruit flavors heartily enveloped in oak.

Produced in Boudes, one of the cru villages of the Côtes d'Auvergne, this is a young fruity wine. It has light tannins that are there to enhance the stalky red fruits. Acidity and a crisp aftertaste complete this attractive wine. Drink now.

This popular brand's white version is soft and smooth. There are some citrus flavors to give the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of the wine is more towards apricot and perfumed green plums. Drink now.
wine_name: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

wine_desc: This wine is light straw-colored, with aromas of lemon blossom, lemongrass and freshly cut lawn. Flavors of peach, passion fruit and melon finish with a touch of residual sweetness.
wine_name: Jidvei 2015 Nec Plus Ultra Demisec Sauvignon Blanc (Jidvei)

wine_desc: The Borba cooperative is in one of the most productive Alentejo wine regions. With this simple and fruity wine, it has captured warmth as well as ripe tannins. Berry fruits and acidity give it a lift. Drink now.
wine_name: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Brado Red (Alentejano)

wine_desc: Light, clean apple aromas lead to a basic palate with skin-driven texture. Airy green fruit and citrus peel flavors finish mild and fresh. At 11.5% abv, this is about as light as good wine gets.
This wood aged Chenin Blanc has a strongly oxidative character. It has lost its fruit in favor of grilled almonds, toast and intense acidity. Drink this mature wine now.
wine_name: Château de Chaintres 2013 Clos des Oratoriens  (Saumur)

wine_desc: In the Boissonneau family since 1839, this southern Entre-Deux-Mers vineyard gives a crisp, herbal wine with light fruit and attractive acidity. It has lemon and grapefruit flavors, bright with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
wine_name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

wine_desc: While this wine has high acidity, it also offers attractive fruitiness. It is light and bright, with a layer of spice and pepper. Drink the wine now.
This wine is tight and young. It will have crisp citrus acidity as it matures, giving a bright, lively wine, refreshing to drink and just right for food.
A pale-colored wine with crisp, tight red-currant fruit, this is light and lively. Drink this simple, attractive wine now.
Vegetal-leaning aromas of beans, peas and squash lead to a round somewhat flabby palate. Green, herbal flavors crowd out mild citrus and melon notes in front of a low-acid soft finish.
wine_name: Santa Ema 2016 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

wine_desc: A vibrant purple color and foxy berry aromas announce the jammy palate and punchy acidity of this wine. It tastes of herbal plums and berries and doesn't hold up on the oaky, pulpy finish.

A gritty element shares space on the nose with peach and melon aromas. This feels round and basic. Flavors of lightly buttered white fruits don't amount to much, while this tastes a bit like salted butter on the finish.
Subtly scented, this opens with aromas of citrus zest, spring flower and wild berry. It's fresh and informal, with light strawberry and sour-cherry flavors supported by fresh acidity.
This is a crisp wine, almost tart. It needs to soften to allow the red-currant fruitiness to shine. It will be attractive after late summer 2017.
wine_name: Maison Bouey 2016 Collection Baruaud Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

designation: Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche
wine_desc: This fruity, crisp wine offers layers of acidity and bright fruit, with a refreshing burst of red currants. It's delicious and ready to drink now.
wine_name: Maison Bouey 2016 Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: This sound, basic white blend is made from Merseguera and Sauvignon Blanc grapes. Its apple and melon flavors are tasty but simple, the fruit falling off quickly on the finish. Drink now.

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: This Ribera del Duero smells more forced than natural, dominated by oak and clove scents. Its tough, woody palate matches the nose, with resiny berry and plum flavors. On the finish, a strong clove flavor is backed by modest berry fruit.

This wine's charred nose suggests over-the-top oak. The palate is a rough road of hard grape skin tannins. Char and clove flavors blanket its savory, meaty berry fruit, finishing woody and redolent of clove.

This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.
wine_name: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Red (Alentejo)

wine_desc: This is an attractive fruity wine. With its soft texture, perfumed white fruits and balanced acidity, it is the sort of wine that is ready for a warm day. Drink now.
This wine has aromas of cranberry and black raspberry. It offers soft tannins and flavors of cassis, black cherry and cherry vanilla before the fruit-filled finish.
wine_name: Bostavan 2014 Via Etulia Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)

wine_desc: Made with Nero di Troia grapes, this has aromas of wild rose, citrus peel and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The bright informal palate offers sour cherry and strawberry accompanied by zesty acidity.

Made with Montepulciano grapes, this has fruity aromas of crushed berry and citrus. Reflecting the nose, the light easygoing palate offers suggestions of sour cherry and tangerine zest alongside bright acidity.
wine_name: Cantina Ariano 2016 Sogno di Volpe Rosato (Puglia)

wine_desc: A blend of Loureiro, Arinto and Avesso, this light and fruity wine has an edge of prickle along with great acidity and citrus flavors. It is a great summer food wine. Drink now.
wine_name: Casca Wines NV Cascas White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This wine's light, sugary, red cherry and watermelon aromas lead to similar flavors and a light, lean texture. It has a bright coral color that's eye-catching.

This 19th-century chateau is situated on the plateau above the Garonne near Cadillac. A soft wine, it's lightly fruity and with a crisp edge. It offers attractive red-berry fruits and just the right acidity. Drink now.
wine_name: Château Carignan 2016 Château Léon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: With a yeasty aroma, this Vignobles Siozard wine is ripe with hints of yellow fruits as well as a smooth texture. It is soft, with just a final tang of acidity.

The Mottet family bought this chateau in 2009 and has been in renovation mode: chateau, winery, vast vineyards and placement of a dramatic 40-foot steel rooster in the vineyard. This wine is refreshing, lively and crisp, with plenty of acidity. It reveals spice, apples and lime flavors along with a more mineral side. The wine is ready to drink.
This Ducourt wine is tight, with considerable acidity that masks the fruit. Let it calm down for a few months when those red fruits can assert themselves. Drink from late 2017 (think Thanksgiving).
Lively and crisp, this wine offers a pure line of citrus fruit. Its acidity and herbal edge are right up front, refreshing and aromatic. The wine is ready to drink now.
The tomato and plum aromas in this Garnacha blend are a bit soupy. Its chunky palate is heavy with generic berry fruit and a touch of oxidation. A solid, middle-of-the-road pour.

The wine, named after a typical mustache from the 19th century, is all fruit: ripe blackberries with balancing acidity. This is an easy ripe wine that will be great with barbecues this summer thanks to its soft tannins and drinkability.

A blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, this is a smoothly ripe wine. Its cherry and spice flavors are given just a hint of structure built by a tannic edge. This soft juicy wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Lisboa)

appellation: Pays de Loire, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: Chardonnay from the producer's vineyards in Anjou is the base for this wine. It has a soft creamy texture that is light and fruity without any sign of wood aging. It is round, smooth and ready to drink now.
wine_name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2016 Chardonnay (Pays de Loire)

wine_desc: Flat, earthy raisin and prune aromas in this Garnacha indicate very ripe, almost desiccated fruit. The palate is much like the nose: flat and low on vitality. Jammy blueberry and herbal flavors finish chunky, without lift or nuance.
Generic berry, cherry and plum aromas are saucy and earthy. This everyday Cabernet feels rubbery and grabby. Slightly stewed berry, spice and herbal flavors finish bumpy, with hard tannins.
wine_name: Finca Patagonia 2015 Expedicion Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

wine_desc: A medium-sweet wine, this offers crisp apples as well as touch of honey. It has attractive acidity bringing the texture of the Chenin Blanc into great focus. Drink the wine now.
wine_name: Foucher-Lebrun 2015 La Vigne des Sablons Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

wine_desc: The white from baseball players Chris Iannetta and Vernon Wells includes 12% Sauvignon Musqué and was aged six months in oak. The oak shows through in abundance, accenting a lush mouthful of baked pineapple fruit.

Reedy, slightly green red berry aromas come with oaky milk chocolate notes in this blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Bobal. Its woody, lean flavors are shy on fruit, tasting mostly of oak on the scratchy finish.
wine_name: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2015 Fatum Red (La Mancha)

wine_desc: This varietal Xarello feels more flat than vivid. It has fleshy yet generic white fruit aromas, ripe melon flavors and a tired finish.
wine_name: Raventós de Alella 2015 Tina 20 Pansa Blanca (Alella)

wine_desc: This is a young and fruity wine that has the rare Vital grape in the blend. It is crisp although with an attractive creaminess that gives the wine a smooth texture. The acidity and red apples are balanced and make the wine ready to drink.
This nonvintage rosé comes packaged in 187ml cans, with four to a pack. Lightly sugary flavors of simple strawberry fruit recall inexpensive California brands—except with a slightly tinny finish.
wine_name: The Great Oregon Wine Company NV Rosé (Oregon)

wine_desc: Aromas of wood, citrus peel and oak-related coconut introduce a choppy bumpy palate with raw acidity. Lean dry tart red-fruit flavors come with peppery spice and oak notes, while this finishes with earthy berry flavors and rubbery choppy tannins.
The wine is full of acidity and with stalky fruit. There is a sharp edge that detracts from the otherwise fruity character of this light crisp wine. This is ready to drink now.
This is a crisp, clean and refreshing wine. There is just the lightest sense of tannin giving the wine a zingy edge. Other than that, it is red-berry fruits all the way. Drink now.
Rich cola and cinnamon spiciness round out this light-bodied, somewhat disjointed effort, which presents as syrupy and dense in texture.
wine_name: Elkhorn Peak 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: Aromas of wild berry, crushed aromatic herb and a whiff of dark spice slowly take shape in the glass. On the firm linear palate, tight youthfully austere tannins support tart sour cherry, cranberry, anise and freshly ground clove. This still needs a few years to fully open and develop. Drink 2022–2032.

A lively whiff of white blossom, Muscat grapes and lemon enticingly streaks the nose. These flavors continue on a feather-light and dry palate where fresh acidity makes them shine even brighter. This wine is all about expressing the most delicious, dry but totally aromatic lightness. Refreshing and made for summer, it has an irresistible lemon finish.

Hazelnut and lemon can be sensed briefly on the nose. The palate adds bright lemon notes and riper notions of yellow Mirabelle plum, with an overall impression of freshness and stony depth on the midpalate texture. The finish is clean, dry and lasts long, with a pure lemon note.
wine_name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2016 Heideboden Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is 82% Merlot and 18% Cabernet Sauvignon, coming from Cold Creek and Four Feathers vineyards. Designed with the specific intent of aging, brooding aromas of blue and red fruit, earth and spice lead to a saturated seamless palate. It drinks beautifully now, but should have a long life in front of it. Best after 2022.

Aromatic notions of summer blossom and freshly cut pear appear on the nose. The palate brings out ripe, rounded and juicy pear notes alongside a textured, slightly phenolic midpalate that adds backbone. Rounded with rich fruit, it has a briskly clean finish.

appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
designation: Esprit de Tablas Grown and Bottled on the Estate Mourvèdre-Grenache-Syrah-Counoise
wine_desc: An elegantly integrated dark-red-cherry component distinguishes the nose of this blend of 40% Mourvèdre, 35% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 5% Counoise, with hints of sagebrush and baking spice. The food-friendly palate combines dark-berry flavors with dried herbs, graphite and light sarsaparilla, with well-integrated acidity and a silky yet firm texture.
wine_name: Tablas Creek 2014 Esprit de Tablas Grown and Bottled on the Estate Mourvèdre-Grenache-Syrah-Counoise Red (Adelaida District)

wine_desc: This is a big, dry and compelling wine made from an unusual combination of Cabernet Sauvignon, Mourvèdre and Zinfandel. Wood smoke and black-pepper aromas join quite ripe blackberry and blueberry flavors, while firm tannins support full body and all that wonderful richness. It's perfect for a casual meal headlined by a slab of beef.

Aromas of ripe berry, exotic spice, menthol and underbrush slowly take shape in the glass. It's full-bodied, offering raspberry jam, crushed herb and star anise set against fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2026.

The bright, tart flesh of early-season apples tingles enticingly on the nose. The palate follows with tart sweetness, mimicking the sweet but refreshing crunch of a ripe but tart apple. The body is delicate, with a balance that teeters between sweet and tart. Totally refreshing, it finishes with lasting echoes of apple.

A smoky, flinty touch of reduction joins ripe notes of green and yellow pear on the nose. The palate lets the pear fruit come to the fore but also presents a wonderfully textured body with a creamy, yeasty element and hints of ripe grapefruit. Zesty and fresh, the finish gives equal consideration to earthy and fruity elements.

Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this opens with scents of violet, perfumed berry, crushed herb and a whiff of tilled earth. The bright elegant palate conveys raspberry, cherry, licorice and cinnamon framed in firm, refined tannins. Drink 2019–2026.

appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: A pithy tangerine aroma meets with yellow melon, sharp lemon and lime rinds, oak shavings and yeasty toast on the nose of this bottling by Christian Roguenant. There is a sharpness to the palate, with strong acidity and a grippy texture framing margarita-like flavors of salt and citrus.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas bring notes of flower, herb, cigar box, spice and cherry. The cherry flavors are sweet and luscious, showing a lovely sense of balance and texture, with an extended finish capping it off. Impressive stuff.
Lemon, orange blossom and rose aromas start this exotic and refreshing wine. On the palate, bright flavors of citrus mingle with melon and pepper. Easygoing but distinctive.

You'll find aromas suggesting underbrush, wild berry, tobacco and a whiff of aromatic herb on this. The palate isn't quite as expressive as the nose and is still tightly wound, offering red cherry, cranberry and white pepper alongside a backbone of tense tannins and bright acidity. Give it time to unfold. Drink 2025–2035.

Underbrush, truffle, baking spice, leather and tobacco aromas segue over to the smooth full-bodied palate along with raspberry jam, licorice and clove. Seasoned polished tannins provide elegance and structure. Drink through 2027.

A fragrant blend of 80% Nebbiolo and 20% Vespolina and Croatina, this stunning red offers enticing scents of dark-skinned berry, tilled soil, new leather, dark spice and a balsamic note. Elegant, structured and savory, it boasts juicy black-cherry, raspberry, white-pepper, cinnamon and tobacco flavors set against a backbone of firm, refined tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2019–2030.
wine_name: Centovigne 2012 Il Centovigne Red (Coste della Sesia)

wine_desc: Rose, violet, crushed mint and red-berry scents mingle together in the glass. On the tight palate, bright acidity and taut fine-grained tannins frame cherry, strawberry, star anise and dried herb. It's a great introduction to this classic vintage. Drink 2021–2028.

Favorable exchange rates have lowered the price of this gem to nearly everyday status, making it a terrific value. Ripe melon and red berry flavors are supported by a firm bed of crushed stone, then garnished by subtle spice notes. Typical of Tavel, it's on the full-bodied side for a rosé, but doesn't seem heavy at all. Drink now–2018.

The Gonet family's investment, which began in 1998, has begun to bear fruit. This wine comes from the second in a row of fine Bordeaux vintages. The style of the vintage is well represented in this richly endowed wine with its swathes of black fruits, its rich tannins and its warm full texture. This is just coming together after a quiet period for the vintage. Drink from 2018.

A touch of honeysuckle works its way through the peachy, lemony nose of this indigenous Austrian. The palate brings out peach and a perfumed, rose-scented phenolic edge. Although the texture is rounded, the palate is fresh and firm. Ripeness and exuberance are coralled into lively and very appetizing freshness.

The nose is aromatic and zesty, with alluring grapefruit-peel spice. On the palate these flavors relax and coalesce into a juicy but concentrated whole made up of lemon and ripe Mirabelle plum—an irresistible contrast between juicy flesh and tart zest. The body of this invigorating wine is dry, brisk and slender.

appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: In addition to the blackberry base, minty herbs, leather and turned loam on the nose, this bottling offers a strong woody character, with cedar, sandalwood and pine needle aromas. The very dry black-currant fruit is awash in flavors of dill, savory black pepper and black olive. Tannins are sticky but not overly aggressive.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: True ice wines are a rarity in the Northwest. This one brings honeyed aromas of dried pineapple and mango that draw you into the glass. The flavors are sweet and rich but still manage to remain light on their feet. It's a perfect end to any meal.
wine_name: Kiona 2016 Estate Grown Ice Wine Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

wine_desc: New leather, ripe woodland berry, aromatic herb and a balsamic whiff of menthol are some of the aromas you'll find on this full-bodied red. The savory structured palate offers dried Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, cinnamon and pipe tobacco set against a firm backbone of fine-grained tannins. A sage note wraps up the finish. Drink 2019–2031.

appellation: Dominio de Valdepusa, Central Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Stout, leathery aromas of black fruits and grilled meats are blackened and a true reflection of Syrah. This is expansive on the palate, but also acidic and abrasive. Flavors of baked black plum, blackberry and fig are intense. A chewy finish is ripped with power, an indication that this will last a long time; drink through 2027.
wine_name: Marques de Griñon 2013 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Syrah (Dominio de Valdepusa)

designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
wine_desc: Slightly overripe aromas of raisin and prune dominate the nose on this jammy, spongy-feeling gran reserva. Soft, ripe cassis and plum flavors come with spice and tobacco accents. On a savory finish, prune comes back into play, thus cementing a ripe, jammy essence. Drink through 2025.
wine_name: Marqués de Murrieta 2010 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)

wine_desc: Subtle aromas of dark berry, espresso, exotic spice and French oak slowly take shape on this. The firmly structured palate offers sour cherry, cranberry, coffee and licorice while close-grained tannins provide an assertive backbone. Drink 2023–2033.

appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Intriguing aromas of saltwater taffy, churned butter, lemon drop and cotton candy show on the dairy-powered nose of this bottling of the historic vineyard by the Duckhorn-related producer. Lemon cream and white-peach flavors show on the sip, where a strong salty character cuts through.
wine_name: Migration 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This 50-50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah comes from adjacent blocks planted in 2002. It was aged in new French oak for 42 months, so the nose delivers rich aromas of sugar plum, gingerbread spice and black-cherry syrup. The palate is quite dry, with a dark-chocolate bitterness, woody juniper flavors and firm, structured tannins that give depth to the black-plum core and vanilla-pie-crust touch on the finish.
wine_name: Monte De Oro 2011 Vigna Vicini Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)

appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
wine_desc: This is a serviceable, if nondescript Chardonnay. In a highly competitive category it doesn't stand out in any way. It's just a light expression of apple flavors, with a quick finish that leaves a slight impression of glue.
There is a slight prickle that gives a surprise lift to this dry wine. Along with that is crisp fruit (lemon and apple flavors) and a refreshing amount of acidity. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Arinto (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This is a soft wine with its creamy fruits assimilated into the tangy texture. There is plenty of acidity to give this wine its cool character as well as its citrus and green-apple flavors. Drink now.
wine_name: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Branco White (Vinho Verde)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is lighter in color, with aromas of sawdust, cherry and barnyard. The style is quite faint, with spice flavors on the finish.

Wiry currant and plum aromas show a touch of oak in this value-priced wine. It feels somewhat chunky on the palate, with scraping tannins. Herbal plum flavors finish gamy and with a mild note of oaky clove.
wine_name: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Carmenère (Central Valley)

wine_desc: Merlot remains a challenge for most Oregon producers who attempt it. This does not rise past the impression of light and grapey soda flavors, with some stiff earthy tannins.

This opens with subdued aromas that evoke dried yellow flower and overripe citrus peel. The aromas carry over to the lean brisk palate along with suggestions of lemon, bitter yellow-apple skin and an unusual funky hint of crushed black olive.
This light-bodied wine has a pale pink Provençal color but quite a bit of fruit flavor. It feels soft on the palate and tastes lightly sweet.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Aged entirely in neutral French oak, this wine takes a light, simplistic approach in its presentation of golden honey apple and pear flavor.
This is tight and rubbery in feel, without much depth or give to the palate. Herbal tea aromas accent generic red fruit scents. Raspberry, red plum and salty flavors finish choppy but clean.
wine_name: Cellers Unió 2015 Clos Dalian Crianza Grenache (Terra Alta)

appellation: Castilla La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
wine_desc: This Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo blend has mild, prickly cactus and citrus aromas and a mix of tropical and green flavors with a slightly bitter finish. It's an everyday white with low acidity.
wine_name: Chapter Capítulo 8 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Castilla La Mancha)

wine_desc: This blend of 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is lightly herbal, with a touch of attractive tannins. It's ripe but preserves a crisp edge to balance the caramel flavor. The wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Château Carignan 2016 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Light and fruity, this is a crisp wine with good acidity. a tangy character and a yeasty edge. Drink now.

Brightly fruity, this blend with 85% Sauvignon Blanc goes for the tropical-fruit character of the grape. Attractive acidity and a zingy edge are balanced by ripe apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink from late 2017.
Barrel toast and smoky gunpowder scents give this wine a savory edginess before revealing medium-bodied layers of baked blackberry and cherry.
With no concession to fashionably pale rosés, this is a boldly colored wine. It has red-berry fruits, a soft caramel texture and crisp acidity to balance. Of course, it is ready to drink.
wine_name: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Aragonez-Syrah Rosé (Alentejano)

wine_desc: A tidal wave of oak-derived aromas, mostly maple and milk chocolate, engulfs the nose of this Monastrell. On the palate, it's creamy yet wiry, its oaky mint and vanilla flavors blending with acidic tastes of currant and red plum before settling into an oaky, scouring finish.
Aromas of citrus fruits, green herbs, grass and celery set up a shear lean palate with little body and pointed acidity. Tart lemon-lime flavors are crisp and scouring on the finish.
wine_name: Indomita 2016 Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

wine_desc: This wine has light citrus aromas and flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and yellow peach. Pleasant fruit sweetness marks the finish.
Smoke and baked plum notes provide flavor within this wine's easygoing structure and approachability.

appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Deep, dark espresso bean, loam and graphite aromas hide any sense of fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers more ripeness, in the form of black cherry, with an added kick of graphite, but the overall impression is quite simple.
Delicate scents of spring blossom and citrus carry over to the bright simple palate along with sour cherry. Zesty acidity gives it tangy finish.
wine_name: Orion Wines 2016 The Wanted Zin Blush Rosato (Puglia)

wine_desc: This everyday wine feels chunky due to low acidity. Its dusty aromas are generic and not very fruity or expressive, and its meandering cherry and plum flavors precede a simple finish.
A blend of simple stone-fruit and citrus aromas exhibits a touch of vegetal green. This feels balanced but highly regular, while briny citrus and persimmon flavors hang around on the finish.
Briny pithy citrus aromas and a standard-feeling palate tell you this is regular but solidly made. Citrus flavors are largely ripe, while pithy grapefruit notes are found on the finish. Drink now.
wine_name: Viñedos Marchigüe 2016 Marchile Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)

designation: Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
wine_desc: Fernão Pires with Sauvignon Blanc allows the second grape's herbal nature to shine. So it is crisp, citrusy and with intense acidity. The wine has a ripe feel with hints of tropical fruit at the end. Drink now.
wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

wine_desc: Made in a crisp linear style, this is picked at a modest level of ripeness. The result is a relatively low alcohol wine, but one that lacks generosity, instead offering one-dimensional notes of tart grapefruit that linger on the finish.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Plum aromas meet dried oregano, graphite and bell pepper touches on the nose of this bottling. Light strawberry flavors are accented with an iron-tinged character and more bell pepper on the palate.

appellation: Muscadet Coteaux de la Loire, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: This is a lightly perfumed wine with crisp acidity and bright lemon flavors. There is a fine zesty tang to this attractive ready-to-drink wine.
wine_name: Domaine Guindon 2015 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Coteaux de la Loire)

wine_desc: This is a young tannic wine. It needs time to show up the red fruits that are underneath the dryness. There is potential for a fine juicy softly textured future. Drink from 2018.

appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
wine_desc: This dry rosé is 100% Merlot, fermented in stainless steel. It's rather flat in both mouthfeel and flavor, with nondescript one-dimensional red fruit.
Named after the pheasant (Faisão), the wine is crisp enough to be refreshing. It is medium sweet and lightly textured with orange zest. Drink now.

Briary berry and cassis aromas are spicy and solid. In the mouth, this Carmenère is raw and tartaric in feel. Salty plum, coffee and herbal green flavors finish about the same, with a note of cured meat and residual acidic tang.
wine_name: François Lurton 2015 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

wine_desc: Peachy aromas come with an oily essence. This basic Chardonnay feels plump and generic, with a shot of zesty acidity. Slightly salty melon and peach flavors don't change much on the finish.
wine_name: Haras de Pirque 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

wine_desc: The wine is all tangy zesty fruit. With plenty of apple and grapefruit acidity, it is lively, textured and bright. Drink now.
wine_name: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Colheita White (Alentejo)

wine_desc: A crisp and taut wine, this is nervy and lively with attractive fruitiness. It is still young, with acidity very much to the fore. Drink from late 2017.
Pale in color, this crisp wine offers a touch of yeastiness that contrasts with the red-currant fruits. It has plenty of bright acidity as well as a tangy, zesty aftertaste.
A rounded and soft wine, this is already open and ready to drink. It has a full-bodied character although without great fruitiness. The aftertaste is gentle and smooth.
This wine has a touch of caramel as well as spice. Both work well with the red fruits that shine through this ripe wine. It is ready to drink.
This wine is soft, although with plenty of ripe fruit. It has a touch of spice and light acidity, showing the richness of the white-wine vintage. Drink now.
This wine is soft and misses out on crisp fruitiness. Hints of the wood aging give some spice to the rounded wine.
This is a green, grassy style of wine, with lively acidity, refreshing fruitiness and a mineral edge. The wine is ready to drink.
This crisp and fruity blend is dominated by 80% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is bright with intense, refreshing acidity and a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
wine_name: Cheval Quancard 2016 Chai de Bordes Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Melon, wood spice and vanilla aromas are common for this level of Chilean Chardonnay. A plump palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of pear, oak and skins-based bitterness. A woody tasting finish is adequate.
This simple and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. And with its red fruits, light acidity and crisp texture, it succeeds. Drink the wine with summer barbecues.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Lees notes lead off the aromas and lend a creamy, rich texture to the palate as well. It's a distinctive approach to the variety, not for all tastes.
Pungent earth dominates the nose of this wine while cherry and cassis notes play on the painfully light-bodied yet smoothly textured palate. Smoky oak lingers on the finish.
wine_name: Tierra y Mar 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

wine_desc: This unusual rosé is a cofermentation of 80% Pinot Noir and 20% Pinot Blanc. It's an uneasy compromise, with neither grape really taking the lead. Kind of like one of those awkward wine and food combos where the whole is less than either of its parts. Sour strawberry flavors thin out quickly; that's about it.
wine_name: Yamhill Valley 2016 Rosé of Pinots Pinot Blanc-Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

wine_desc: This is a delicious and ripe-fruited wine. Dominated by Fernão Pires, it has an apple-puree texture: smooth and creamy. The wine has an edge of light acidity at the end to give it a lift. Drink now.
wine_name: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Barrel aromas are in the lead here, with notes of sawdust and cedar, along with Band Aid and gamy notes. Dark fruit aromas are in the background. The full-bodied flavors reveal more of the same, showing a lot of heat.

This simple fruity wine is perfumed and attractively fragrant. With a blend that includes the unusual Perrum grape (also known as Pedro Ximenez in the Sherry region of Spain), it is smooth, refreshingly creamy and ready to drink.
wine_name: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)

wine_desc: Named after a local order of monks in the Middle Ages, the wine is rounded and easy. The gentle fruitiness gives the wine a zing of acidity. That's balanced by the open and smooth texture and flavors of creamed apple. Drink now.
wine_name: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

wine_desc: Green herb aromas are up front on this wine's slightly stale nose. Its plump melon flavors are short on zing, tasting dry and yeasty with a low-acid finish.

appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
wine_desc: This is a soft wine, lightly creamy and with simple red fruit, citrus fruits and acidity to match. It is an easygoing fruity wine that is ready to drink.
wine_name: Cave de Saumur NV La Petite Marquise Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

wine_desc: With plenty of citrus flavors, this wine is fruity while also tight and mineral textured. At this stage, it is all about acidity, so it needs to age for a few months. Drink from late 2017.
This wine is crisp, taut and with a strong mineral texture. Spice and green-fruit flavors are shot through with acidity and have a steely edge. Hold the wine until late 2017 for it to soften.

Heavy oak is a front-row theme throughout this tannic, extracted, black-tinted Garnacha. Hot fudge sundae and sawmill aromas lead to a palate that's as tannic as sandpaper. Its charred, heavily oaked flavors finish chocolaty, with a lasting and overbearing taste of clove, lacking balance and clarity of fruit.
This blend of Trajadura and Alvarinho comes from the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is cool and perfumed with apricot as well as creamed pear flavors. Drink the wine now.
wine_name: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 Blue White (Vinho Verde)

designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte
wine_desc: This is a young fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits and gentle tannins that are surrounded by the comfortable full-bodied texture. It's a wine to drink now.
wine_name: Santos & Santos 2016 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Red (Alentejano)

appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
wine_desc: Cab Franc is often a high point in lineups of red wines from the Rogue Valley, but this one misses the mark. A sweaty nose gets it off to a rough start, and the flavors of stems and green tannins do nothing to help the tart generic fruit. It might slip comfortably into a flight of budget Bordeaux from a cool year.
Here's a fun everyday rosé that offers delicate raspberry and citrus flavors alongside fresh acidity. It's simple but well made, with a clean finish.

Briny saltwater aromas dominate a mild mostly fruitless nose. This feels basic and round, with a lemony streak. Mild nectarine flavors don't amount to much, while this is simple and generic on the finish.
Light, bright and fruity this is an easy-to-drink off-dry wine for the summer. It is clean and crisp, apples and pears set off by floral aromas. Drink now.
wine_name: Vinihold 2016 Caiua a Noite White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: Part of a range of wines that showcases the different styles of Portugal's regions, This wine is smooth, creamily textured and with a warm ripe character. It has pineapple and mango as well as crisper lemon flavors to give a rich wine that is still poised and finely balanced. Drink now.

designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da Baía Branco
wine_desc: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is a classic for the region. It gives a light and perfumed wine with a creamy texture and plenty of balancing acidity. Bright and fruity, the wine has just a final tang to add crispness. Drink now.
wine_name: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

wine_desc: The smooth flavors of Fernão Pires make this wine. They give a ripe character of whisked cream and apples. The wine is totally ready to drink.
Without any wood aging, the wine shows just the yeastiness from aging on the lees. That fills the palate with spice and a touch of pepper. The wine needs a little more time. Drink from 2018.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This stainless steel-fermented wine opens with white flower scents and grassy, herbaceous notes, following up with tart lemon and melon on the palate.
wine_name: Geyser Peak 2015 River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: Honey gold in color, this wine made from an indigenous Georgian grape has a bouquet of white cherries and lavender. Tart flavors of honeydew melon and white plum persist into the soft floral finish.
wine_name: Gotsa Family Wines 2015 Dry Unfiltered Chinuri (Georgia)

wine_desc: Reduced and slightly green, this wine shows a preponderance of puckeringly dry tannin and grippy oak amidst its ripe black fruit.
wine_name: Hanna 2014 Red Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

wine_desc: This Garnacha-Carignan blend contains some Syrah as well and smells almost exclusively of clove and spice. On the palate, it's resiny and sticky, with overwrought clove and barrel spice flavors that dominate the finish.
Ripe and smooth, this is rich with red berries. A touch of pepper accompanies a zesty texture that backs up the fruitiness. Drink now.
This vivid pink-colored wine, 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is soft, with gentle fruitiness and crisp edge. Acidity and a herbal edge add a more textured character. Drink now.
wine_name: Château des Arnauds 2016 Les Caprices d'Anaïs Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: The palest pink in color, this wine has a crisp texture but not much fruitiness. It is light with a touch of perfumed acidity. Drink now.
This wine is reduced and somewhat flat in tone, with simple, light-bodied ripeness and plum and raspberry flavors.
wine_name: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Two Range Red (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: Aromas of animal hide, rubber and herbal berry fruits are not lovable. This has a heavy scratchy mouthfeel and lightly green flavors of berry fruits mixed with unabsorbed oak. This tastes toasty and blackened on an abrasive finish.

designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva
wine_desc: There is plenty of juicy acidity in this wine even though the fruit has a strangely steely character. The tannins give it a firm character that needs to soften.
wine_name: Santos & Santos 2013 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva Red (Alentejano)

wine_desc: This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is rustic with some hard tannins and intense acidity. Since it is still young, the wine could soften but it seems to be more about its structure than its fruit.
wine_name: Santos & Santos 2015 Quinta da Cidadoura Red (Lisboa)

wine_desc: This blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Verdejo is light in body, with stalky haystack aromas and dilute nectarine and melon flavors. Its yeasty finish is somewhat bland.
The Encruzado and Malvasia blend is both fruity and intensely perfumed. It has a touch of lychee as well as crisper grapefruit. Drink the wine starting now.
Spicy and fruity, this light, balanced wine has easy, crisp fruit and bright acidity showing citrus and spiciness. It is a refreshing wine, ready to drink now.
Light-bodied and easygoing, this has delicate whiffs reminiscent of spring flower and red berry. The extremely simple fruity palate shows sour cherry and a hint of raspberry.

In this Verdosilla, an obscure white variety from the Valencia region, yeasty, bready aromas are mild and slightly floral. Its palate is watery and not very crisp, with dry apricot flavors that have no zing.
This linear wine's neutral aromas vaguely resemble peach and peach pit. Its yeasty, leesy, oxidized white fruit and white bread flavors finish on a melony note but with little intensity.
wine_name: Raventós de Alella 2015 Santa Maria Pansa Blanca (Alella)

appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
wine_desc: Made entirely with the native grape Bombino Nero, this informal light-bodied wine has subdued aromas of wild cherry and a hint of crushed herb. The aromas carry over to the über-simple palate along with a hint of pink grapefruit.
This Bobal's roasted berry and funky animal aromas hardly lay down the red carpet. Its dry spice and oak flavors smother berry and plum fruit, tasting herbal and minty on a heavy, grippy finish.
This wine is tart, with considerable crisp acidity. That gives it a fruit-juice freshness, although the acidity should be calmer than it is.

This is a light wine from the stable of offerings from the Courselle sisters. It has a pale character, just hinting at citrus flavors and lively acidity. It is an apéritif style, light, bright and ready to drink.
This wine has aromas of pomegranate juice and dried cherry. Flavors suggest pomegranate juice and tart cherry conserves.

Familiar aromas of herbs and olive make up the nose along with berry scents and hints of tree bark and mocha. A choppy palate is shrill with tartaric acidity. Spicy berry and plum flavors turn lean on a scrubbing finish.
A candy-pink-colored wine, this is crisp, fruity and off dry. There is a touch of caramel that fills out the otherwise acidic and red-currant-flavored palate. The wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Rosé (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This Bobal's roasted berry and funky animal aromas hardly lay down the red carpet. Its dry spice and oak flavors smother berry and plum fruit, tasting herbal and minty on a heavy, grippy finish.
This wine is tart, with considerable crisp acidity. That gives it a fruit-juice freshness, although the acidity should be calmer than it is.

This is a light wine from the stable of offerings from the Courselle sisters. It has a pale character, just hinting at citrus flavors and lively acidity. It is an apéritif style, light, bright and ready to drink.
This wine has aromas of pomegranate juice and dried cherry. Flavors suggest pomegranate juice and tart cherry conserves.

Familiar aromas of herbs and olive make up the nose along with berry scents and hints of tree bark and mocha. A choppy palate is shrill with tartaric acidity. Spicy berry and plum flavors turn lean on a scrubbing finish.
This wine has aromas of honeysuckle and lemon curd, with flavors of lemon-meringue pie and lemon pith. The finish is clean and crisp.

A blend of Nero di Troia and Negroamaro, this simple wine has delicate aromas suggesting red berry, wild flower and a whiff of sea breeze. Bright and informal, the rather diluted palate offers hints of raspberry and strawberry alongside fresh acidity.
As peppery as a jalapeño, with persistent spiciness, this wine offers high-octane ripeness and a healthy cradling of oak, finishing with a touch of heat.
This wine has a ripe texture, rich fruit and touches of spice. Full bodied and tangy, it's smooth, with a hint of caramel. Drink now.
wine_name: Château de Belcier 2016 Fleurs de Belcier Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Soft and ripe, this caramel-flavored wine has hints of strawberries. Drink now.
This Rioja's rubbery aromas are so strong they suggest industrial tires. It has grippy tannins and a blackened flavor profile that includes bacon fat. Drying tannins make for a rough finish.
This wine has aromas of pomegranate and black plum. It conveys flavors of cranberry and black raspberry. The finish is short-lived yet pleasantly acidic.
The wine is crisp and as light as a feather. The fruitiness brings with it apple and pink grapefruit as well as warmer golden plums and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
A light, bright and fruity wine from the Lafite stable, this is a fine apéritif style. Crisp green fruitiness comes with a hint of a more steely character. It is ready to drink.
wine_name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2016 Légende  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: This deep-garnet-colored rosé has a nose of raspberry, rose and aniseed. A bright entry leads to tart flavors of cherry, pomegranate and Seville orange. A bitter-almond note appears on the soft, slightly flat finish.
wine_name: Gotsa Family Wines 2014 Dry Unfiltered Tavkveri Rosé

wine_desc: Dusty applesauce aromas lead to a pulpy, medium-bodied palate in this pure Xarello. It tastes of bitter grape skins , papaya and green melon, its tropical notes offset by grassy and briny hints on the finish.
It's obvious there has been some oak aging here, because the wine is packed with spiciness and toast. That rather diminishes the fruit. Made to be drunk young, it may miss the target.
This funky, grassy expression of the variety was fermented entirely in stainless steel, is thin on the palate and tastes of exotic passionfruit.
The wine is full of the taste of superripe fruit. That gives a juicy character as well as the softest tannins. It is ready to drink.
Bland apple and citrus aromas are oaky, with a note of popcorn. This feels plump and short on core acidity. Melon, applesauce and oak-resin flavors finish flat and with a flavor note of fresh butter.
Aromas of orange blossom and wild berry lead the way. The bright simple palate is on the slender side, offering suggestions of strawberry and cherry alongside vibrant acidity.

Charred resiny oak aromas dominate herbal berry fruit. This is rough and raw on the palate, with sizzling tartaric acidity and forceful tannins. Flavors of burnt black coffee and herbal plum finish with a ring of excess acidity.
A tan color and dusty, tired aromas put this Chardonnay on short notice. Its plump palate delivers a mix of stone fruit and bitter, skin-based flavors, with a static finish.
wine_name: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Chardonnay Chardonnay (Valencia)

wine_desc: A pure citrus-flavored wine, this is refreshing and light. Its crispness will soften over the next few months, but drink now for the forward fruitiness.
wine_name: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Carrelet d'Estuaire  (Bordeaux Blanc)

wine_desc: This smells mostly of oak and barrel spice, with barely any fruit seeping through all the wood grain that's on display. Plump on the palate, this overoaked Chardonnay tastes almost entirely of resin and spice. Throw in clove and vanilla flavors on the finish, and you get the picture.
Candied berry aromas are jumpy, herbal and foxy. This has a raw pinched mouthfeel and minty herbal plum and berry flavors. On the finish, green elements rise to the level of herbaceous.

Applesauce and woody aromas don't offend but they aren't anything special or enticing. This feels chunky and fairly flat. Woody resiny flavors are low to empty on fruit, while this tastes yeasty on the finish.

Gritty aromas with a matchstick element are low on fruit and driven by pyrazines. This feels round but short on kick. Flat peppery somewhat bitter flavors are low on fruit, while this tastes of white pepper on a lightly bitter finish.

This is almost red in color, with spicy bell pepper aromas resulting from early harvested Cabernet Sauvignon. Its full, chunky palate shows yeasty, lightly green and peppery flavors that linger on the finish.
wine_name: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosado (Navarra)

wine_desc: Earthy mossy spicy aromas are the high point on this edgy rubbery amped-up Carmenère. This is blocky and chunky on the palate, with blueberry and leathery flavors. Lively but rough feeling on a peppery, herbal finish.
wine_name: Viña La Fortuna 2013 Twelvestone Carmenère (Lontué Valley)

importer: Georgian House of Greater Washington, LLC
wine_desc: Golden honey in color, this wine proffers a one-note nose of guava. Flavors of guava, apricot and flint culminate in a lightly floral finish.
This wine is slightly flabby and overtly ripe, making for a dull experience on the palate.
wine_name: Flora Springs 2015 Family Select Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: This somewhat flat, green and tannic wine is reduced and sour in tone, with medium body and broad acidity.
While the wine is dry, there is a fruitiness to it coupled with a caramel flavor that certainly makes it seem sweeter. With a crisp aftertaste, the raspberry flavored wine is ready to drink.
wine_name: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

wine_desc: Here's a light-bodied casual wine that has subdued aromas suggesting white flower, orchard fruit and a hint of almond. You can find traces of the nose on the extremely simple diluted palate.
This simple rosato has subdued aromas suggesting red berry and a whiff of wild flower. The light informal palate evokes sour cherry and orange zest alongside tangy acidity.
wine_name: Cantine Ermes 2016 Marchese Montefusco Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

wine_desc: This wine has a caramel edge that gives richness but also detracts from the fruit. It offers a smooth texture along with a spicy edge. Drink now.
wine_name: Château de Lisennes 2016 7 Hectares Vin Bio Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: A light and bright wine, this offers plenty of herbal fruit that is lifted by crisp acidity. The wine is refreshing, lively and ready to drink.
This crisp wine has plenty of acidity as well as lively fruits. The structure and texture are light and lifted, with a clean aftertaste. Drink now.
This wine is smooth, soft and gently fruity, with a rounded texture that only hints at crispness. It's in an easy apéritif style.
This medium-bodied rosé has aromas of strawberries and rose petals, and flavors of cherry, strawberry and tart cherry. The finish is clean, with a slight touch of residual sweetness on the palate.
This is soft and medium sweet. It does have a light-red plum-skin texture to give it some shape. The wine otherwise is clean, fruity and slightly candied. Drink now.
wine_name: Lacheteau 2016 Marquis de Goulaine La Roseraie  (Rosé d'Anjou)

wine_desc: This semisweet Muscat is gold in color and has aromas of caramelized peaches and honeysuckle. Flavors suggest dried apricots and canned peaches.

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: This wine's basic red fruit aromas are clean but flat. That flatness carries over to the palate, which feels rubbery and lacks acidity. Its bland plum and cherry flavors are slightly bitter, concluding with a low-energy finish.
This flat, watery wine has yeasty, generic stone fruit flavors and salty, bitter grape skin flavors. It's round in mouthfeel but inexact on the finish.
Spicy aromas of green tobacco blend with plum and berry notes. This Merlot is drying and tannic on the palate. Leafy flavors are fairly green, with generic black-fruit notes keeping it afloat.
This blend of Gamay and Prokupe has aromas of tart cherry and Mediterranean herbs. Flavors recall cherry, black plum and stewed prune.

Aromas of wild berry and a whiff of pressed spring flower lead the nose on this casual wine. The vivacious, slightly fizzy, palate offers black cherry and a candied citrus peel note alongside tangy acidity.

The white wines in the Wine By Joe portfolio are fresh, well-made and offer exceptional value. It's tougher to do with Oregon Pinot Noir. This thin, disjointed and simple wine has aggressive vegetal character and unappealing earthiness.
A typical off-dry wine, lightly spritzy and with just enough acidity to balance. The fruit is the thing. The low alcohol makes it a fine summer wine. Drink now.
This is a simple fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits, giving it a light and bright character. The wine is rounded and smooth, with an attractive lift of acidity at the end.
Smooth and simple, this wine offers aromas of citrus pith, cantaloupe and green apple. Flavors suggest honeydew and tart apple juice.
wine_name: Domeniile Sahateni 2015 Nomad Dealurie Munteniei Chardonnay (Dealu Mare)

wine_desc: A light, slightly sparkling wine for summer drinking, this is off dry with good acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

There is no compromise in the pinkness of the color of this wine. It is fruity with plenty of acidity and with a touch of caramel as well as some light tannins. Drink this blend of Syrah and Aragonez now.
wine_name: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Rosé (Alentejo)

wine_desc: Blended with 15% Merlot and aged in both French and American oak, this wine shows generous eucalyptus and mint notes. The smoothly textured, rounded palate is marked by black cherry and woody perfume.
This is a blend of Alvarinho and Loureiro, two of the most emblematic grapes of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is crisp, attractively fruity and light and poised. Drink now.
wine_name: Casa da Torre 2014 Sousa Lopes Unfiltered White (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: Showing the ripeness of the vintage, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine, with plenty of yellow and citrus fruits. The wine needs a few months, so drink from late 2017.
This candy-pink-colored wine offers candy-pink-colored flavors. It conveys caramel as much as fruit, although with acidity and a tangy aftertaste.
This is a tight wine with acidity and a good future of crispness. Give this attractive wine a few months and its citrus fruit will show well. Drink from late 2017.
This soft-textured and almost-sweet tasting wine drinks more like a white than a rosé. It tastes off-dry and has low acidity, a syrupy mouthfeel and ripe pear flavors.
wine_name: Michael Sullberg 2016 Lot 94 Dry Reserve Rosé (California)

wine_desc: With its light prickle, this crisp strawberry-flavored wine is medium sweet but with acidity to balance. It's easy, fruity and ready to drink.
wine_name: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Padeiro Rosé (Vinho Verde)

wine_desc: This yellow-looking Chardonnay smells briny and like oily popcorn. The palate is both watery in feel and resiny. Nutty, salty flavors of popcorn crowd out apple notes, while the finish is dilute.

Meaty aromas and scents of stewed red-berry fruits are rustic. This feels hard and high in unabsorbed acidity. A strong smear of buttery oak rests on top of edgy currant and red-plum flavors, while this is spicy and oaky on the finish.
wine_name: TerraNoble 2014 Reserva Terroir El Algarrobo Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

wine_desc: The mild but slightly tired aromas of apple, honey and haystack announce a soft palate with apple, nectarine and tropical flavors. A yeasty, somewhat hollow finish indicates this is starting to break down. Drink this 80% Chardonnay and 20% Viognier blend immediately.
wine_name: Viñedos Marchigüe 2015 City Wine Reserva Chardonnay-Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

wine_desc: Lime and orange aromas smell more like a household cleanser than honest fruit. A chunky palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of yeast and white bread more than fruit. Bitterness on the finish transitions to yeasty as this fades.
Apples and limes lend their crispness to this otherwise bland wine. It is sweet with light fruitiness and a bright acidity. Drink now.
Earthy oaky horsey aromas lack charm and seem clipped. This Carmenère is hard-edged and scratchy in feel, with lightly green berry flavors. A full but choppy finish creates a rough conclusion.

appellation: Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Reduced prune and green herb aromas tell you all you need to know about this jammy, overextracted Petit Verdot. Its roasted black fruit flavors come with hints of spice and chocolate, but drilling tannins and overbearing weight hinder the finish.
wine_name: Hello World 2015 Petit Verdot (Tierra de Castilla)

appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
wine_desc: Made with Bombino Nero grapes, this casual rosato has subdued aromas of red berry and spring flower. It's extremely simple and light-bodied, offering a suggestion of raspberry and citrus alongside zesty acidity.
wine_name: Cantina di Ruvo 2016 Grifo Rosato (Castel del Monte)

wine_desc: A light-colored rosé, this is too pale for its own tastiness. There is acidity, but not much else.
wine_name: Château Côte Montpezat 2016 Le Canon Côte Montpezat Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

wine_desc: Leafy earthy berry aromas are mild at best. This feels flat despite a shock of red-berry acidity that doesn't sit right. Plastic and jammy raspberry flavors show some oak that fails to integrate itself on the finish.
wine_name: Chilcas 2014 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

wine_desc: A green nose lacks fruit and instead smells oily and like matches. An O.K. palate feel is helpful, while flavors that hint at passion fruit but are essentially vegetal aren't a plus. On the finish, asparagus and canned bean flavors rise up.
wine_name: Viña Chocalan 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

wine_desc: This Xarello feels juicy and acidic but ultimately lean and simple. Its grassy aromas include a whiff of hay and a touch of mango while its generic citrus and tropical flavors finish with acidic pop.
wine_name: Alta Alella 2016 Privat PB Organic Pansa Blanca (Alella)

wine_desc: Almost white in color, this wine has just a touch of red fruit and acidity. In making it so light in color, the producer seems to have removed the flavor as well.
wine_name: Château de la Rivière 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
