wine_name: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)

wine_desc: This is a balanced wine with fine young tannins and plenty of blackberry and black-plum fruits. It is ripe while keeping plenty of acidity. The wine is going to develop well and should be ready from 2019.

While this wine is firm at the moment, it does have fine black fruits. The acidity from the blackberry fruitiness is going to balance with the tannins shortly to give a ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2018.
This ripe smoky wine has fine tannins and plenty of red-berry fruits. With its acidity, dusty texture and crisp aftertaste, it is not made for long aging. Drink from 2018.

Lightly stalky because it is still young, this wine otherwise promises rich black-currant fruitiness as it matures. It is balanced, ripe and with a gentle set of tannins in the background. Drink from 2018.
This dense wine has ripe tannins and generous fruits. Its black-fruit flavors are full of spice and acidity with a crisp texture. Drink this wine from 2018.
Dusty tannins show the ripeness of the fruit in this wine. With its black-currant fruits and acidity, it is balanced and almost ready to drink.

appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Fermented and aged in concrete eggs, this wine brings unusual aromas of grape skins and grape nuts that lead to dry and leesy fruit flavors. It's a unique interpretation of the variety.
wine_name: J. Bookwalter 2016 Willard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: Attractive aromas of violets, clove, pepper and plummy fruit give way to leather and spice on the palate. This is medium bodied and firm, with some dusty, metallic notes on the finish. Drink now.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Unusual aromas of wet copper penny, rubbed sage and black cherry are followed by tart cherry and cranberry flavors. The aromas and palate seem disconnected.

Herbal blackberry and jammy black-plum aromas are forceful and brutish. This Toro has a hard, collapsed, jammy palate and overripe berry fruit flavors. A dense, chewy, baked finish is solid but lacks elegance.
The aromas are light in style, with notes of tin, mint, berry and wild raspberry. The flavors are light and cranberry tart, not bringing the heft to stand up on their own.
Lazy berry and mild raisin aromas sit heavily in the glass. This crianza is rubbery and grabby in feel, but also pretty big. Stewed berry and prune flavors finish with some excess weight.
Grapefruit, strawberry and roses lead on the nose of this friendly pour. Cherry and flowers on the palate are playful and easy drinking. A great patio pour with a fun character.
wine_name: Wine Art Estate 2016 Pink Bang Rosé (Drama)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is mostly Merlot (77%), fleshed out by Cabernet Sauvignon (20%) and Petit Verdot. Fresh aromas of plum, herb, bittersweet chocolate and red fruit are followed by medium-bodied, lightly sweet fruit flavors. The tannins bring some grit and it shows some heat on the finish.
wine_name: Zero One Vintners 2015 Sauce Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

wine_desc: Grape-jam aromas and ripe, sweet flavors make this wine attractive in its easygoing, accessible style. For a deep, dark red, it has a surprisingly soft, velvety texture and a mild amount of sugar.

appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Fleshy stone-fruit aromas announce a fuller-bodied wine made from Garnacha. Straightforward citrus and nectarine flavors are fresh and clean, continuing to a pithy, slightly briny-tasting finish.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Lots of primary aromas show on this bottling, including Concord grape, grapeseed, raisin and fresh-pressed blackberry juice, along with a hint of licorice. The wine is somewhat light in body, but with lots of enjoyable black fruit and anise flavors.
Rose, sage, menthol and cellar floor aromas carry over to the palate along with raw sour cherry, cranberry and clove. Assertive tannins clench the astringent finish.
wine_name: Boasso 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Melon, Animal Cracker and tropical fruit aromas lead to a plump but solidly fresh palate. A mix of stone-fruit and pink-grapefruit flavors is chiseled, and tastes a touch peppery on the finish.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This wine is sourced from the Wood Vineyard along the appellation's Eastside Road, a relatively warm location that adds rich lemon chiffon and graham cracker to the whole. Creamy and velvety on the palate, it remains lush on the finish, tasting of baked peach pie.

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: This blend of 70% Grenache, 20% Carignan and 10% Cinsault smells plummy and superripe, balanced out by hints of crushed stone. It's medium in body and creamy in texture, with nearly overripe flavors that stay just on the fresh side of raisin. Drink now.
wine_name: Cave de Rasteau 2015 Ortas Les Viguiers Red (Côtes du Rhône)

wine_desc: Solidly structured, this is a dense wine. Its black fruits add to the density, giving a concentrated, fruity wine. Drink this starting from mid-2018.

Ripe and structured, this is a concentrated wine. Its blackberry fruits are powerful and dense with tannins as well as acidity. It will take some time for the juiciness to really show, so wait until late 2018.
This young wine is so full of fruit. Blackberry and delicious acidity combine with some light tannins to bring out the charm of this fine vintage. Drink from 2018.

A romantic name for an easy fruity wine. Spice from wood gives the black-currant fruit richness and some complexity. With its acidity and dry core, this is a wine to keep for another year. Drink from 2018.
This is a ripe wine with generous black fruits and crisp acidity. It is balanced—fruity with a core of tannins. Drink from 2018.

appellation: Vin de Pays de Vaucluse, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: A medium-bodied blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah, this is a crisp, plummy wine with hints of leather and earth. It's juicy and mouthwatering on the finish, but don't expect it to last—drink it over the next six months or so.
wine_name: Cuvée Jean-Paul 2015 Red (Vin de Pays de Vaucluse)

wine_desc: A nose of lemon compote, spice and grapefruit leads this wine from Drama. Citrus and tropical fruit on the palate is crisp and bright, but offers some weight. A spicy finish ties it up nicely.
wine_name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2016 Château Julia Assyrtiko (Drama)

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: Lightweight and silky in texture, this is a dry, refreshing rosé to drink while the warm weather persists. Hints of bubblegum detract slightly, but the primary notes of melon, citrus and wet stone combine easily on the palate.
wine_name: Domaine Guy Mousset 2016 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Featuring a fat, short, ornately dressed holy man on the label, this is one of the most visually compelling brands to hit the market in a while, but the wine inside isn't so exciting. Black fruit and slight licorice show on the nose, with blackberry and cola on the palate.

appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Quite shy on the nose, this bottling offers crushed lava rocks, pencil shavings, dried herbs and prune aromas. The flavors are also reserved, with dried oregano, black olive and elderberry emerging.
The wine is young, tight with tannins and with layers of intense acidity. Behind that, however, there is some smoky fruitiness that will come through. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château du Peuil  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
wine_desc: Smoky, slightly nutty aromas dissipate with aeration to reveal fresher notes of apple, lemon and pear here. While closed and tight in profile, fresh acidity and juicy citrus flavors are easygoing and approachable.
wine_name: Lieb 2015 Reserve Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

wine_desc: A nose of redcurrant signals tart freshness. The palate has this in spades but seems tinged with bitter earthiness that detracts from the berry charm. This light, fresh wine would benefit from chilling. Drink soon.
wine_name: Martinshof 2015 Zum Martin Sepp Zweigelt (Weinland Österreich)

wine_desc: Tightly wound and leathery on the palate, this wine is ultimately light-bodied. The flavors mix dried cherry, blackberry, tobacco and sage.

This juicy, wood-aged Pierre Lurton wine has very ripe fruit. That gives it richness with black-plum fruits and a dense texture. A bitter coffee flavor shows through the fruit. It needs time, so drink from 2018.
Structured and at the same time fruity, this is a wine with good potential. Its tannins and its acidity are balanced to give a warm wine that will be fine to drink from 2019.
This is a structured wine, juicy with black-currant fruit and acidity. It will develop quickly, softening its tannins and filling out with ripe fruit. Drink from 2018.

appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Bright aromas of peach, pear and nectarine are followed by lightly sweet fruit flavors. It brings some appeal but the apparent residual sugar gets in the way.
wine_name: Coyote Canyon 2016 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Charred, meaty aromas and equally smoky flavors give a rowdy personality to this full-bodied blend of Bordeaux grapes. Firm tannins and underlying acidity create a puckering mouthfeel.
wine_name: Dante Robere 2014 Element 116 LV Red (Livermore Valley)

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Cheesy oak aromas and murky fruit scents are less than what Atauta usually offers. Chalk it up to the rough conditions of chilly 2013. In the mouth, this is choppy. Roasted berry and earthy notes precede a tannic, rubbery finish.
wine_name: Dominio de Atauta 2013 Parada de Atauta  (Ribera del Duero)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Robust in oak, this full-bodied expression of the variety is reduced on the palate, showing sizable tannin weight and length. Plum, dark cherry and dried herb combine to offer swirls of flavor.
wine_name: Foppiano 2014 River's Edge Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: Part stainless-steel fermented and part barrel-fermented, this wine showcases a happy medium between crispness and body. It has a slight metallic edge, with integrated layers of Meyer lemon, melon and kiwi.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of purple fruit, cocoa, green-pepper, vanilla and cherry bring easy-drinking pepper and cherry flavors. The concentration seems surprisingly light and the fruit a bit green given the quality of the vintage.
wine_name: Gamache 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Barrel aromas are up front, with notes of wood spice alternating with game and dark fruit. The fruit, wood and game flavors mix in equal parts on the palate, not entirely in harmony.
wine_name: Ambassador Vineyard 2014 Limited Varietal Selection Estate Grown Petit Verdot (Red Mountain)

appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
wine_desc: This is a medium-strength white, richly constructed to show concentrated flavors of vanilla bean, apple and toasted oak.
Roasted, leathery and rubbery berry aromas are gritty and short on brightness. This feels rugged but good. Jammy cassis and cherry flavors show notes of cocoa and herbs.
wine_name: Bodega Classica 2015 Hacienda Lopez de Haro  (Rioja)

appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Baked black-plum aromas meet with star anise on the nose of this bottling. The texture is easy and light on the sip, where somewhat muddled flavors of mulberry and dried earth ride a decent acidity that rises toward the finish.

A pale blush color in the glass, this wine has a soft bouquet, offering hints of white currant, cherry and melon, all dusted with fennel pollen. Bitter orange and melon rind flavors unfold on the medium-weight palate, with ample acidity to lift the finish. Drink now.

appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: This luxury cuvée combines Syrah with Vermentino in a wine that resembles Sauvignon Blanc for its lively citrus and passion fruit aromas and flavors. A bit of oiliness gives it weight on the midpalate, but it finishes zesty and refreshing.
wine_name: Château de Campuget 2016 1753 Syrah-Vermentino Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

wine_desc: The wine is balanced, structured and with some fine ripe black fruits. It is dense in its fruitiness and tannins. Give it until 2019 before drinking.
This attractive fruity wine is full of young black-currant and red-berry fruits. The tannins mingle with spice to give a contrast to the aura of fruitiness surrounding the wine. Drink from 2019.
Fruity and with fine tannins, this wine is already tasting good. It has juicy acidity, lots of ripe tannins and black-currant fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2018.
Although low in alcohol this wine has a rich, smooth texture that adds more mouthfeel than usual. It blends plum and strawberry notes and has soft acidity.

Fresh, composed aromas suggest a stick of fruit-flavored chewing gum. This wine has a pulpy palate and a hint of spritz that makes it tastes soda-like, with red-apple flavors and a touch of peppery bitterness.
wine_name: La Bodega de Pinoso 2016 Vergel Rosado (Alicante)

appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
wine_desc: From grapes grown at this estate and vinified by the Tutiac cooperative in Blaye on the north bank of the Gironde Estuary, this wine is easy, soft and fruity. With black-currant fruit and acidity, it reflects the fruitiness of the vintage and is likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from late 2017.
wine_name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Château les Jouberts Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: A 100% varietal expression of the grape, this is soft and simple, medium bodied and quite tannic, with highlights of green herb and tomato leaf.
wine_name: Merriam 2012 Jones Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

wine_desc: Clean but standard citrus and apple aromas set up a mild, citrusy palate. This wine offers green banana, melon and citrus flavors in front of a similar-tasting finish.

Upfront fruit aromas present the bouquet much like a fruit salad, with forward scents of guava, mango, banana and citrus supremes. The palate is similarly fruited, with ample acidity to keep the ripe fruit flavors in check. It's a direct, fruit-forward drink.
Very fruity and rather soft in texture, this wine has a sense of sweetness from the buttery, grape aromas to the ripe, almost jammy flavors and gentle finish.

Tropical fruit aromas and flavors of mango, vanilla and melon give this white blend an exotic spin. Mild acidity gives the wine lift, but the style is easy-drinking and offers a long finish. Pair with poultry or grilled seafood.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Pale peach in color, this wine starts out a bit reduced, which causes initial distraction. The citrus flavors are light, with the concentration not seeming to be all there.
wine_name: Tamarack Cellars 2016 Rosé of Mourvèdre (Columbia Valley (WA))

appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Light in color, intriguing aromas of cedar, mushroom, orange peel, smoke and cigar box are followed by somewhat faint elegantly styled red-fruit and spice flavors. It falls a bit flat on the palate.
wine_name: The Walls 2014 Wonderful Nightmare Stoney Vine Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: A strong smoky aroma, spicy oak flavors and a blast of ripe fruit make this a boisterous wine. It's full bodied, with heat on the palate. A little berry and cherry concentration comes through on the finish.

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: Honeydew, crushed stone and hints of ground cinnamon and clove are appetizing upfront. This Viognier from the Southern Rhône is full and round on the palate, with ample weight and a trace of bitterness on the finish.
wine_name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Grand Veneur Blanc de Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
wine_desc: A buttery, plummy aroma, and flavors like cherry cobbler make this medium-bodied, dry wine attractive to sip. A rather firm texture keeps it appetizing.

Aromas of sour berry, blue flower and leather emerge on this medium-bodied red. The palate is raw and lean, showing unripe cherry, sage and grainy, aggressive tannins that segue into an astringent finish.
wine_name: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2013  Barolo

wine_desc: A fruity, perfumed wine that has attractive acidity as well as spice. The black currant fruit gives the wine a crisp edge as well as an easy approachability. Drink now.
The wine is firm with tannins as well as black-currant fruit. It does have a juicy edge that will develop well as it matures. Drink this potentially attractive wine from 2018.

To date, Godelia has done better with its Mencía than Godello. This wine smells like pine, wheat and match stick, all aromas related to underripe fruit. A stalky, corny flavor profile lacks ripeness, a theme that's replayed on the finish.

With an edge of tannin and with sweet strawberry fruits, this Doublet family clairet is an attractive wine. Dark pink in color, it appears and tastes rich. With its peppery aftertaste, this has to be a wine designed for food.

A clear salmon color in the glass, this value-priced rosé opens with attractive notes of white flowers, strawberry and peach, with the faintest hint of white chocolate in the back. Despite the rich, ripe aromas, the mouthfeel is lightweight and well balanced by ample orangy acidity.

appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Light lemon butter meets with Key-lime pith and a steely minerality on the nose of this bottling from the pioneering property that is now owned by Bill Foley. It's very light on the palate, with touches of citrus, apples and cider-like spice, proving easy to sip.

appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
wine_desc: Initial whiffs of smoke and spring ramps blow off with significant aeration, revealing fresh tart notes of raspberry and cherry. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a refreshingly brisk Pinot Noir rosé that rewards those with patience.

Medicinal, grapy berry aromas come with a hint of latex and Band-Aid. This flush, fruity Toro feels grabby and tannic. Uncomplicated, bold flavors of plum, blackberry and cherry are brash on the finish.

This is a wide-bodied, fully mature Albariño with an oily nose that lacks sizzle and is coming up on mealy. Flavors of grape skins and melon are dry, earthy and a touch bitter. A peachy, flat-feeling finish indicates that its drinking life is nearly over.
wine_name: Pazo de Barrantes 2014 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)

appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
wine_desc: Zesty lime, lemongrass and green apple aromas are inviting on the nose of this dry full-bodied Riesling. It's slightly nutty and savory on the palate with flavors of pressed apple and pear. Crisp lime acidity freshens the finish.

A slightly volatile nose hints at ripeness but does not suggest much fruit. The off-dry palate rounds out flavors and adds a hint of strawberry to a tart lemon core. The body is light and slightly diffuse. Drink soon.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Pale pink in color, the aromas offer notes of strawberry, bubblegum and apple. Lightly spritzy, it brings forward somewhat-weighty-feeling fruit flavors. Despite the spritz, it seems a bit ponderous.

This opens with aromas of French oak, weedy underbrush, coffee and a whiff of burned rubber. The palate is muddled, showing dried black cherry, toast, salt and a confectionery note alongside grainy tannins.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Primary aromas of grapeseed and blueberry are mixed with touches of old clove and dried tobacco on the nose of this blend. Dusty and dried fruit flavors show most intensely on the sip, with extremely strong gingerbread spice.
wine_name: AronHill NV Quatre Melanges Red (Paso Robles)

wine_desc: Celery and watermelon flavors give this pale pink, medium-bodied wine an herbal character. With a good balance between crispness and smoothness, it tastes refeshing and leaves a lingering finish.

appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
wine_desc: Zesty and spry on its feet, this light-bodied rosé offers more mineral than fruit. It's still quite closed in profile, but reveals delicate red-cherry and apple notes as it aerates.
wine_name: Bedell 2016 Taste Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

wine_desc: Yeasty aromas are simple and low on both fruit and acidity. Flavors of almond skins and lightly salted stone fruits finish mellow, without much snap.
Light red-fruit aromas include a note of chewing gum. This wine is medium in body and solid in feel. Currant and nectarine flavors are basic and snappy, persisting on the finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Rosé Tempranillo (La Mancha)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This is an intense wine, robustly ripe and showy in oak. It tastes of baked apple and vanilla wood.
wine_name: Chasseur 2014 Graton's Choice Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: A bright and juicy wine, this has good potential. Its red-berry fruits are right up front along with some light tannins. Drink this fruity wine from 2018.
Soft and muddled in smoky oak and generous tannin, this wine mixes red currant, raspberry and dried herb, easygoing and robust on the finish.

appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This blend of 50% Syrah and 50% Cabernet Franc is a bit over the hill, so drink up now. Prune, raisin, leather, roasted meat and pepper show on the nose, while the palate offers dried cherries and dust.
wine_name: Cooper-Garrod 2011 Test Pilot F7U-3 Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_desc: Smoky-sweet oak aromas and ripe black-cherry flavors add up to a solidly built, medium-bodied wine that's not too tannic. The spicy, charred character is pretty strong, but enough sweet-seeming richness matches it.
Aromas of peach pit, apricot and melon are basic but a little mealy. A chunky palate seems soft due to waning acidity. Flavors of melon and papaya finish slightly flat and bitter. Drink immediately.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Deep blueberry fruit, sweet tobacco, chocolate syrup and minty lift show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard to the far south of Paso. An almost overwhelming, eye-watering acidity presents intense flavors of baked blackberry and dried herbs.
wine_name: EOS 2015 Santa Margarita Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

wine_desc: Plum and berry aromas are superficially good, but this nonvintage Garnacha feels pulpy and chunky. Forceful berry flavors are a bit flat, as is the finish, which is ripe in feel and flavors but weaker on acidity and vitality.
wine_name: Ignacio Marín NV El Gordo Garnacha (Cariñena)

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Concentrated and slightly dried red cherry meets with cola on the nose of this densely packed, heavy-bodied bottling. The palate shows very dried red fruit with a touch of nutmeg spice.
wine_name: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
wine_desc: Aromas of espresso, vanilla and coconut open. The palate is extremely tight and lean, showing underbrush, coconut, toast and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins. It has a rather green astringent finish.

importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
wine_desc: Coconut, French oak and camphor aromas carry over to the palate along with oak-driven spice, toast, raw sour cherry and a green note of powdered sage. It doesn't have much have much fruit richness while astringent tannins give it a raspy finish.

An unusually deep salmon color and strong, red-wine flavors tip the scales to the heavy side. This rosé also has more body than is typical, with fruit notes like peaches and cherries shaded by earthy accents.

This Viura smells oxidized and soft, with barrel-based aromas in charge. A soft, watery palate is resiny, tasting bready and yeasty more than fruity. If you dig around, there's some complexity and quality, but this is not the best vintage for Capellanía.

Strong butterscotch aromas and rich, seemingly sweet caramel and melted-butter flavors give this full-bodied wine a syrupy character. The balance is quite soft and oaky components overwhelm the fruity ones.

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: Bright, fruity and crisp, this silky-textured rosé has a refreshing finish and bold, pink bubble-gum-like (but dry) flavors. Drink now.
wine_name: Pont du Rhône 2016 Passion Terroirs Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

wine_desc: Smoky oak and a distinct note of birch mark the nose of this broadly built, full-bodied and robustly ripe wine. Grippy tannin and leathery texture give it extra weight and breadth, with a green undercurrent of cedar and peppercorn lurking beneath.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Light aromas of freshly shucked corn and spice lead to a medium-bodied straightforward palate. It's straight down the fairway.

appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
wine_desc: Fresh apple, lemon and peach notes are shaded by darker tones of dusty mineral and struck flint in this medium-bodied Pinot Grigio. It's a bit closed in profile, but refreshing and dry with an invigorating lime finish.
Aromas of new leather and menthol segue into the brooding palate along with dried cherry and a note of medicinal herb. It's tightly tannic, with a lean astringent finish.

This Carignan-based rosé is soft and pretty, with delicate aromas of pink peony, white cranberry and strawberry hull that dance in the bouquet. The palate is fresh yet ripely fruited, with lingering tones of lime and orange peel on the clean close.

appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: This light- to medium-bodied wine comes across as playful for its aromas of cotton candy and bubble gum. On the palate, it's still a bit confected, but is clean, dry and refreshing.
wine_name: Gabriel Meffre 2016 Château Grand Escalion Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
wine_desc: While tart red-cherry and red-apple notes are pleasant, there's an earthiness that persists throughout this dry Merlot rosé. It's light in body with a tangy finish.
wine_name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2015 Dry Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

wine_desc: Raspberry and cherry aromas are at the fore of the bouquet, with an attractive floral character teasing in the background. The palate offers ripe, juicy fruit flavors that are lifted by ample acidity and finish quick yet clean on the close. Drink now.
wine_name: Calmel & Joseph 2016 Villa Blanche Grenache Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

wine_desc: The wine is all juicy red-currant and berry fruits. With light tannins and a crisp edge the wine is fruity and ready to drink.
Red cherries give this wine a soft open feel. It is light on structure, more about crisp acidity. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Château Jean Faux 2015 Les Sources  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

wine_desc: This Grandeau wine is tight and firm. The tannins are a serious component of a wine that will have more fruitiness as it develops. It just escapes being over-extracted, leaving a crisp aftertaste.
The wine has structure along with juicy generous fruits. Bright fruitiness brings acidity from black-currant flavors. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
wine_name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of overripe, slightly bruised red apple, ale and apple skin are at the fore. It brings a spritz to the off-dry apple-juice flavors, seeming to have not fully settled into the glass.
Light in color, with basic apple and green-melon aromas, this is a mild Verdejo with a fairly plump mouthfeel. A cross of melon and citrus flavors falls off on the finish before turning bitter.
wine_name: Mocén 2016 Eco Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)

wine_desc: This wine is straightforward in approach and uncomplicated in its light-bodied gathering of cola, pine forest and tea notes.
This medium-bodied wine has ripe plum and cherry-candy aromas. Equally fruity flavors are accented by some oak spice, with pretty good balance from mild tannins and acidity.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Feral in earth and mushroom forest, this wine is big in ripeness and body. Sizable tannins distract from the fruit.
wine_name: Viszlay Vineyards 2012 Winemaker's Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: Flat aromas of lacquer and cured ham are not all that fruity, and the palate on this Viura is not deep or serious. Mildly oxidized flavors of white fruits and ham are more savory than bright. Drink immediately.

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Aromas of white peach, honeysuckle and butterscotch are clean but quite plump on the nose of this widely available bottling. Tons of ripe stone fruit show on the palate, along with juicy apples and warm melons, cut by only the slightest acidity.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: The aromas on this bottling are inoffensive but a bit flat, with broad nectarine and light orange touches. There is a citrus twist to the palate and a touch of wet cement.
The wine shows the richness of the vintage while also showing some firm extracted tannins. At this stage, the wine is too dry and firm. Give it until 2018 for a little softening.
This densely structured wine has firm tannins and concentration. The juicy black fruits are still developing to fill out the wine even further. Drink from 2018.
Lightly structured, this is a dry wine that has a rich red-fruit character. There are tannins as well as spice plus a firm edge to this characterful wine. Drink now.
Already a balanced wine, it has black-currant fruit, fine acidity and a juicy perfumed aftertaste. It is likely to be drinkable young.
The wine is crisp and shot through with acidity. That gives the black-currant fruit great intensity as well as a juicy character. The wine needs to calm down, so wait until 2018.
The wine is soft with a fine touch of tannin and some stalkiness. It has black currants that are ripe while remaining crisp. The wine is easy, accessible and ready to drink.

appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Although this opens with foxy aromas that suggest moderate to sketchy ripeness, this Garnacha-Syrah blend feels pretty good. Mild oak, plum and berry flavors are racy on an acidic finish.
wine_name: Coto de Hayas 2015 Garnacha-Syrah (Campo de Borja)

wine_desc: A blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, this medium-bodied wine is slightly confected and bubble-gum-like at first. With a bit of air, it takes on simple, fruity and direct flavors of cherries and berries, but finishes clean and dry. Drink now.
wine_name: Domaine La Tour de Gâtigne 2016 Rosé (Cévennes)

wine_desc: Shy plum, berry and milk chocolate aromas come in front of a palate with little more than scratchy tannins. Baked plum flavors are flat, and the finish is mild.

appellation: Sonoma County-San Joaquin County, California Other, California, US
wine_desc: Compactly built with dense, ripe fruit, this wine offers plummy flavors that lean toward raisiny richness amid a perfumed nose of blackberry and cinnamon. Its full-bodied boldness finishes dry and dull.
wine_name: Ghost Pines 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County-San Joaquin County)

wine_desc: This is a blend of Sémillon and Cabernet Franc. With its creamy texture and bright citrus flavors, it is an attractively fruity wine. Its crisp fruitiness makes it dry, although there is a soft side to the wine that blunts the acidity. Drink now.
wine_name: Jaillance NV Cuvée de l'Abbaye Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

wine_desc: An aggressively oaky aroma, like fresh-sawn boards and lacquer, goes along with the deep-gold color and flavors of butter, vanilla and heavy cardamom and nutmeg. It's full bodied, dry and extreme in style.
Plum, berry and spice aromas are a touch volatile. A hard, flush palate is loaded with rubbery tannins. Baked berry, cassis and prune flavors fall off on a finish that tastes slightly cooked.

appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Very concentrated aromas of kirsch, dried berries, chocolate and spice cake show on the nose of this bottling that is bolstered by 10% Petite Sirah. That density extends to the palate, where treacly black-cherry-syrup flavors mix with baking spice.
Open-grained oak aromas dominate a toasty nose with heat. This feels lean and tomatoey. Flavors of tart plum and pie cherry are almost sour and feel edgy due to severe wood tannins.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Aromas of overripe slightly turned apple and grape skin are followed by dry citrus and guava flavors. It seems quite disjointed.

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is pale peach in color. The 100% Grenache, the wood influence (100% new 500L French oak) is almost completely overwhelming, showing notes of vanillin, wood spice and cream. It lightens up a bit on the dry palate but still can't make up the difference.

appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: This new wine from an estate vineyard is the strong, quiet type that's not effusively fruity but instead emphasizes mineral elements and great structure. An attractive chalky, spicy aroma leads to beautifully restrained red cherry and pomegranate flavors that seem to grow and expand with each sip. The texture is firmly tannic but also polished, supported by perfect acidity that keeps everything sharp and focused.
wine_name: Long Meadow Ranch 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Black-cherry syrup, dark slate, turned loam and cherry-laced gingerbread cake aromas show on the nose of this rich and lavish bottling by Michael Mooney. The palate is extremely juicy and fruit-forward, with complex blackberry-orange peel jam, ginger and vanilla flavors.
wine_name: Mooney Family 2015 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

wine_desc: The nose is still shy and closed. Likewise, the body is taut and will take time to unfurl, but all the structure and promise is already here. This wine is firm and bright, slowly showing dense blueberry notes edged with cinnamon and pervaded by freshness. The structure is firm and still crunchy but with a juicy release. On the finish, white pepper shimmers in the blueberry fruit. Drink 2019–2029.

appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This provides a strong argument that delicate yet flavorful Pinot Noir can indeed come from the Santa Clara Valley. Intriguing and elegant aromas of lavender and violet meet with Earl Grey tea and bergamot on the nose. The palate's light black-plum and black-raspberry fruit are enlivened by purple flowers and a dusting of dried sage.
wine_name: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

wine_desc: The wine, with its firm tannins and solid structure, is still young. The hints of black-plum fruits are way behind the structure. That's all good, because this wine will come together well, to give a rich full wine with spice, juicy black fruits and acidity. Drink from 2020.
wine_name: Vignobles K 2014 Badine de la Patache  (Pomerol)

wine_desc: Brooding, darkly aromatic fruit plays on the nose. The wild blueberry almost has a floral touch of peony. The palate still contains juicy fruit in a taut, firm structure, while tannins are fine but still crunchy. A bright streak of freshness brightens and guides everything, creating juicness and verve, and giving definition to that lovely, ripe fruit. This wine might take a little time to come out of its shell but is worth waiting for. Drink 2019–2025.

appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: Hints of sweet oak meld beautifully with full-fledged fruit aromas and flavors of dark plum and black cherry in this full-bodied wine. It unfolds from a mildly spicy nose to a rich, warm palate sensation and lingering finish. One of several single-vineyard expressions, the Savoy Vineyard is now the FEL estate vineyard.
wine_name: FEL 2014 Savoy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This bottling from the family's estate vineyard in the Foxen Canyon area rides the gamy side of the grape, with sizzling lamb crust, rosemary, black pepper and lavender on the nose. Dense elderberry fruit shows on the palate, with touches of asphalt, chopped thyme and more purple flowers. The acidity is balanced, and the tannins are firm but approachable. A touch of vanilla marks the finish.
wine_name: Fess Parker 2014 Rodney's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This fragrant, concentrated wine offers vivid mint, cherry and clove aromas followed by rhubarb, red cherry and rosemary flavors that are focused and memorable. The balance is spot-on, with good acidity and velvety tannins that brace the richness of the fruit components. Best after 2022.

Underbrush, scorched earth, ripe berry, blue flower and leather aromas take shape in the glass. The full-bodied enveloping palate doles out black cherry marinated in spirits, fleshy raspberry, truffle game and dark baking spice alongside firm, velvety tannins. A licorice note marks the finish. It's evolving quickly and won't need years to come around. Drink 2020–2030.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Spicy acidity wraps around a lengthy and intense experience of full-bodied concentration and power in this well-made wine. Forest pine, red cherry and vanilla combine effortlessly to provide a robust flavor profile that's memorable and rich.
wine_name: Amici 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Nutty, meaty and complex, this crisp, high-toned wine offers food-friendly elegance and refreshment while teasing in savory hints of earthiness. Balanced and dry, it continues to impress as it glides along in the glass.
wine_name: Bodkin 2016 Hotspur Rosé of Syrah (Russian River Valley)

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Beautiful touches of oak and lemon butter meet with sea salt and tangerine pith on the nose of this appellation blend by Bibiana González Rave. The balanced acidity of the palate presents fresh lemon-lime flavors, with a touch of Meyer lemon pith, and is wrapped in a chalky texture.

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: Sultry and inviting aromas of buttercream, custard and white peach are sliced by Meyer-lemon juice, salt and jasmine on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's finely tuned on the palate, delivering butterscotch and pecan flavors dissected by razor-sharp acidity and a chalky texture.
wine_name: Cattleya 2015 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Baked blackberry, vanilla, caramel and tar on the nose make for a very inviting entry into this rich Syrah from Bibiana González Rave, whose father-in-law, Gary Pisoni, co-developed this vineyard. A firm structure to the sip gives backbone to the lush flavors of dark berry, purple flowers, smoky campfire, maple and bacon fat.
wine_name: Cattleya 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

wine_desc: Like many white Hermitages, this is relatively neutral on the nose. But it shows its true potential on the palate, which is full-bodied and expansive, offering hints of grilled peach, melon and baking spices balanced by just enough acidity to extend the finish into mouthwatering opulence. Drink now for its youthful fruit, or cellar up to 20 years.

Black-skinned fruit, iris, espresso, dark spice and a balsamic note all meld together in the glass along with a whiff of chopped herb. The firmly structured palate doles out ripe black cherry, raspberry jam, toast, roasted coffee bean and a hint of oak-driven spice alongside fine-grained tannins.

Tilled soil, lead pencil, thyme, iris and wild berry aromas take center stage on this fragrant red. It's vibrant and young, with crushed strawberry, red raspberry cinnamon and white pepper flavors framed in lively acidity and taut youthfully austere tannins. A licorice note closes the finish. Drink 2023–2033.

New leather, wild berry, violet, white pepper and dark spice aromas come together in the glass. The elegantly structured savory palate offers a nice depth of flavors including ripe morello cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and clove. Tightly wound refined tannins provide the firm polished framework. Drink 2018–2028.

Lush and bright, this comes from one of the coolest sites sourced by the producer, high up and facing the Pacific Ocean. A gravelly texture holds on tightly along the palate, as pear, peach and baked pineapple vie for attention.

appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This richer expression of Pinot Noir kicks off with vanilla and warm cherry sauce on the nose, along with a bit of caramel, enabling it to appeal to lovers of darker red wines. The sip delivers a great depth of berry fruit as well as elegant purple flowers. A chipped-slate minerality is further lifted by dried thyme and bay leaf, making for a hearty but balanced sip.
wine_name: Sea Smoke 2014 Ten Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is a blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon, a whopping 23% Petit Verdot, 7% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc. The aromas leap up from the glass, with notes of garden herb, tar, black cherry and licorice. The flavors are rich and saturated, loaded with black-fruit notes that persist effortlessly on the finish. It shows a fine sense of structure and balance along with a compelling texture. Best after 2024.

Softened by 20% Merlot, this wine tastes of chocolate-covered clove and spicy dried herb, the robust layers of flavor cradled in toasted oak. Fresh and brooding, it offers forest pine, black currant and tobacco in a refined package of integrated tannin.
wine_name: Somerston 2013 Deerhound Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This Bordeaux-style blend leads with 50% Cabernet Sauvignon. Very dark in color and potent in flavor, the wine has grand proportions but is finely polished, leaving no rough edges. It starts with light wood smoke and cedar aromas, and proceeds to mouthfilling black-cherry and dark-chocolate flavors on a creamy but moderately tannic texture. The tannins are well integrated, the flavors are deep and persistent. Best after 2022.

Minty cedar rides atop an expansive succulence in this estate wine that impresses in its ability to support grippy tannin and generous fruit. Blackberry and coffee highlight the flavor spectrum, reaching dark, brooding length on the finish.
wine_name: D.R. Stephens 2014 Walther River Block Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

wine_desc: One of the finest Crozes-Hermitage wines I can remember tasting, this wine combines mouthwatering notes of hickory-smoked pork and dark berries. There's plenty of richness on the midpalate and a long, velvety finish, making this truly a complete package. Drink now–2030.

appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Dense elderberry, charcoal and cracked-black-pepper aromas are lifted by lavender on the nose of this Syrah from a very coastal vineyard near Watsonville. Peppery spice and dried purple flowers make for an intense combo on the palate, where the structure is firm yet the body is relatively light and airy.
wine_name: Waxwing 2014 Lester Family Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

wine_desc: Truffle, violet, underbrush and woodland berry aromas emerge on this elegant wine along with a whiff of new leather. On the smooth structured palate, firm refined tannins wrap around raspberry compote, black cherry, anise and tobacco while fresh acidity provides balance. Drink 2023–2028.

appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Red-cherry sauce, sagebrush, bay leaf and peppercorns show on the nose of this bottling that offers an intense density of aromas. The structure is firm and grabs hold of the palate, where flavors of tart red cherry, chaparral and slate combine.
wine_name: Foley 2014 JA Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: This dark, concentrated number is new from the García family, known for the wines of San Román and Mauro. Like most reds from this clan, this is loaded with blackberry and toasty oak aromas. A massive, raw palate shows abrasive tannins. Oak-forward flavors of blackberry, cassis and coconut finish woody and powerful. Drink from 2018–2028.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: Wood aromas are out front, with notes of vanilla, dill and char, making it hard to get at the fruit. On the palate, the oak almost completely obliterates any sense of the fruit underneath as well. The variety is completely lost.
wine_name: Ambassador Vineyard 2014 Estate Grown Grenache (Red Mountain)

wine_desc: Light apple and earth aromas mingle with crisp fruit flavors without showing much of an oaky component. The wine is medium bodied, fairly crisp in texture and moderate in fruit notes.

appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Restrained aromatically, this bottling shows touches of crushed lava rocks, black pepper and blackberry on the nose. Balsamic vinegar and sour cherry flavors mark the sip, with very sticky tannins.
wine_name: Bella Luna 2012 Grosso Sangiovese (San Benito County)

wine_desc: This wine has an unusually dark color, plus potent and spicy charred-oak aromas. A very aggressive sweet-oak flavor coats over the grape flavors. It stays somewhat sweet on the palate and finish.
The wine is lean, with acidity rather than ripe fruit. It is also tough with tannins. It could come round, although it will always be tough and extracted.
wine_name: Château La Rose du Pin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

wine_desc: A reddish color and lean aromas of cherry skins and plum lead to a pinchy, high-acid mouthfeel. Tart flavors of red plum and citrus fruits are a touch foxy and broken, and seem punchy on the finish.

appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This art-forward, canned-wine project hits a bit of a freshness wall here. The wine is quite light in the glass yet full of dried and tired red-cherry-syrup aromas and an odd cola spice. The palate is somewhat viscous without being sweet, showing concentrated red-cherry flavors and clove spice.
wine_name: Nomadica 2015 Mission Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: Quietly fruity and rather soft-textured, this wine smells lightly herbal and tastes dry. Light honeydew flavors give a little extra interest.
wine_name: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

wine_desc: The wine is tight and dominated by very crisp black currants and considerable acidity. Assuming it can soften and open up, it will be a fruity wine with just a light structure.
This is a dry wine, ruled by tannins. It is firm, the juicy fruit underneath needs time. It will have a juicy future, so wait until late 2018.

This soft spicy wine comes from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region. It has blackberry fruits and balanced acidity, typical of the vintage. The wine is fruity, just backed up by tannins and is ready to drink.

appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
wine_desc: Grapy aromas of black cherry are young and fruity but unsophisticated. This everyday Tempranillo is more superficial than deep in build. Sweet as well as peppery black-fruit flavors finish mild.
wine_name: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Lobetia Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

wine_desc: This herbaceous wine has aromas like snap peas and flavors like fruit cocktail, white pepper and celery. Light to medium in body, it offers good acidity.
This blend of Shiraz and Garnacha is simple on the palate, with modest acidity. Powdery berry and stone-fruit aromas are basic.
wine_name: Vicente Gandia 2016 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Shiraz-Garnacha Rosé (Valencia)

appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
wine_desc: Earthen, savory tones of dusty mineral on the nose open to tart sour cherry and strawberry on the palate of this semi-dry rosé made from Merlot grapes. It's light bodied and zesty but balanced with a hint of sweetness.
wine_name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2015 Semi-Dry Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

wine_desc: This wine's pink color edges ever so slightly toward brown, and offers aromas of orange juice and pink rose petals. It's a tad flat on the palate, suggesting sour orange and lemon rinds, a touch of maraschino cherry and a slight baking-soda minerality.
wine_name: La Crema 2016 Rose of Pinot Noir (Monterey)

wine_desc: This rosé is light in intensity on the nose, with delicate aromas of strawberry hull, white melon and underripe pear. The palate is similarly light and zippy, with prickly acidity and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
wine_name: M. Chapoutier 2016 Les Vignes de Bila-Haut Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

wine_desc: This is a juicy red-fruit-flavored wine. It has attractive tannins and plenty of acidity. With a fresh crisp aftertaste, it is light and will develop quickly.
wine_name: Château de Seguin 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

wine_desc: This is a light and juicy wine, with bright black-currant fruits and a layer of balanced, integrated tannins. It has a dry core that should soften quickly, so drink from early 2018.
Balanced and fruity, this is a crisp wine that has soft tannins. With its bright black-currant fruit, acidity, and touch of spice, it is ready to drink.

This leads with lovely pink peony and carnation aromas, supported by a fruity blend of strawberry, nectarine and melon. The medium-weight palate offers ripe fruit flavors that are braced by ample acidity and a refreshing citrusy note on the close. Drink now.
wine_name: Mas Janeil by Francois Lurton 2016 Les Hauts de Janeil Syrah Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: The aromas on this wine are surprisingly blue fruited for a Cabernet, followed by notes of herb, green pepper and spice. The flavors are lightly sweet, followed by a spice-filled finish. It's a straightforward quaffer that doesn't quite show its variety.
This is a fruity wine, packed with acidity, red fruits and a soft texture. With its crisp open character it is not a wine for long aging, so drink from 2018.
This is a structured wine, firm with tannins. Behind the structure, the attractive black-plum fruits are still developing. The wine is dense and solid and will be ready from 2018.
This perfumed wine, with a dry tannic core, is just beginning to soften. The potential for the black fruits is already there. Drink this solid wine from early 2018.

appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: Quite a bit of spicy, sweet-seeming oak flavors give this full-bodied wine an extravagant flair to match its rather hot mouthfeel and firm tannins.

appellation: Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Strong aromas of pear cider, ripe apples, honey and a slight nuttiness show on the nose of this bottling. That cider flavor continues into the sip, where browned apples and sour-lime flavors show most prominently.

Berry and raisin aromas announce a slightly overripe wine. That's confirmed on the palate, which feels a bit syrupy. Oaky black-fruit flavors are candied, and this Garnacha finishes steady but chunky.
Heavy aromas of raisin, oak and chocolate are copied on the palate that tastes of oak, vanilla and raisiny fruit. It has a woody finish.
The wine is structured with both wood and tannin flavors. It has a juicy core that will develop, so give this wine until 2019.
wine_name: Château des Moines Menodin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

wine_desc: Firm and dense, this wine has solid tannins as well as the potential of ripe black fruits. It has been firmly extracted, although the fruit is there to give the balance. Drink from 2018.

The wine is packed with fruit (including red berries) and attractive acidity. It has tannins that are still very present, although they are now supporting the bright fruitiness of the wine. It's almost ready to drink; just wait until 2018.
This is a spicy wine with juicy crisp acidity and a core of tannins. It is bright, lively and, with its red-fruit flavors, likely to be attractive from 2018.
This fruity wine has a balance between the crisp acidity and the juicy black-currant fruitiness. It is just ready to open up, so drink from 2018.
The wine's stalky character, acidity and black-currants are lit by light tannins. It is likely to age quickly, and be ready to drink from 2018.
wine_name: Château Penin 2015 Cabernet Franc by Château Penin  (Bordeaux)

wine_desc: While this wine shows its wood aging strongly, it is likely that the fruit will be able to push through the spice and heavy toast as it matures. Drink from 2018.

Soft and ripe, this young wine is already to drink. Light tannins and a touch of spice give it just the right amount of richness from this good vintage. The wine is filled with red berries and is ready to drink.
wine_name: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2015 Belle Prairie  (Bordeaux)

appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Nebbiolo and 22% Sangiovese. The volatiles are amped up, bringing distraction from the aromas of cranberry, cherry and vanilla. The fruit flavors are broad and drink quite sweet.

appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Somewhat flat and semi-sweet aromas of uncarbonated cider, yellow pear and white peach show on the nose. Similar sour apple and cooked stone-fruit flavors show on the sip.

appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
wine_desc: This wine is colored like a pale Pinot Noir and also shows some bricking. It brings blunt aromas of cherry and spice that lead to dry,seemingly watered-down fruit flavors. It falls flat.
wine_name: Noviello 2015 Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

wine_desc: This dessert bottling is extremely boozy and woody, with aromas of stewed kirsch, charred oak, tobacco, leather and Bourbon. It's incredibly thick and treacly on the sip.
With plenty of acidity and tannins, this wine is almost trying to be a young red. Drink it like that with food and it will be worth it. The aftertaste has pepper and attractive spice.
The wine has too much wood. Tannins and spice as well as toast are present, but not enough fruit.
Layered tannins and wood flavors have tended to smother the fruit in this wine. That gives a dry, tough character not promising much for the future.

The wine is rich and packed with superripe blackberry fruits. While there is acidity to keep the wine crisp, it does have a heavy feel to it from the high alcohol that also brings a pepper edge. Drink from 2018.
Prickly, sharp aromas of citrus, matchstick and haystack are low on fruit. This Verdejo has a sharp acidic feel and pyrazinic flavors of cactus and bell pepper along with standard citrus.
This Tempranillo smells a bit chemical as well as jammy. A tannic palate is slightly astringent but softens with airing. Medicinal plum and berry flavors stick out on a rough finish.
Firm with tannins, this is a dry wine. Its tough structure dominates the berry fruit, needing time to balance out. Drink from 2018.

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: I continue to be perplexed by the Pagan white Cuvée Lône. Like previous vintages, the 2016 is tight and lean, marked by underripe melon and citrus notes. The blend is 40% Clairette, 30% Bourboulenc, 20% Grenache Blanc and 10% Ugni Blanc.
wine_name: Château Pégau 2016 Cuvée Lône White (Côtes du Rhône)

wine_desc: This is still a young wine, firm with tannins. The enthusiastic wood aging shows strongly in the smoky toasty flavor. It's hard to find the fruit.
wine_name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: Slightly funk kiwi, dried apples and dried white-flower aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. Flavors are flat and muted, with a flash of sweet apples.
This soft and creamy wine has a really bubbly rosé mousse. It has fruit and a crisp clean edge. The strawberry fruits give this wine a sweet character, certainly off dry. It is ready to drink.
wine_name: Jaillance NV Cuvée de l'Abbaye Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

wine_desc: Cassis and raisin aromas lead to a rubbery, grabby and pinching palate. This wine tastes of herbal, leafy berry and plum, while the savory finish lingers.
wine_name: Bodegas Martinez Corta 2015 Cepas Antiguas Selección Privada  (Rioja)

wine_desc: Direct scents of white cherry and currant lead the charge on the nose of this accessible rosé, made from 100% Cinsault. The lightweight palate offers more of the same, with a surprising hit of sweet citrus on the close. Drink now.

Mild, dusty cherry aromas set up a pulling, dry palate. Flavors of tea and spiced tomato lack fruit, and this wine is dry and somewhat abrasive on the finish. The blend is 80% Bobal with Cabernet Sauvignon.

There's a medicinal cherry hint to the nose of this Syrah-based rosé, with additional notes of ripe peach and melon. It's fleshy and full-fruited on the palate, with just enough acidity to keep the ripeness in check.
wine_name: Les Costières de Pomerols 2016 Beau Vignac Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

wine_desc: This is a light- to medium-bodied rosé made exclusively from Syrah grown in the northern reaches of the Rhône Valley. The cooler climate gives it a lighter bearing and redder fruit flavors than many other Rhône rosés: this one resembles red plum and pineapple. Drink now.
wine_name: Cave de Tain 2016 Première Note Rosé de Syrah (Collines Rhôdaniennes)

wine_desc: Dry and structured, the wine has a way to go before the fruit shows. It is over-extracted giving a hard bitter edge. Give the fruit a chance and wait until mid 2018.
Firmly structured, the wine is dry and with dark tannins. Its fruit is currently masked. Give it until late 2017.
wine_name: Maison Hebrard 2015 Château des Trois Tours  (Bordeaux)

appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: Sweet, simple and fruity, this light-bodied wine smells floral, tastes appley and feels soft and sugary to sip.
A generous use of wood aging has given this wine a caramel flavor that lies awkwardly alongside the berry fruits. The aftertaste is dry.
Dry and smooth textured, this is not your typical fresh-pink rosé, but a mature wine with some heft and meaty, melon-like flavors.

This spritzy rosé smells something like orange marmalade. The palate is full despite being bubbly, with orange-peel flavors that turn bitter. The color of this wine suggests skin contact, which is confirmed on a grabby finish.

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: Made in a more savory style, this shows hints of nutty, putty-like aromas alongside cantaloupe and citrus. It's medium in body, with a dry, earthy finish.
Mostly neutral aromas include hints of strawberry and chewing gum. This wine feels dilute, with tangy, tart flavors of pink grapefruit. Pointy, sharp acidity allows the finish to hang around.
Yeasty, briary aromas are low on fruit. This blend of Bobal and Garnacha feels citrusy, with a moderate level of pulp to the palate. Flavors of yeasty citrus fruits turn bready on the finish.
Underripe berry aromas are leathery and briny. This wine is bulky and chewy in feel, with herbal berry and rubbery flavors. A rustic finish with good mouthfeel delivers animal-like flavor notes.
The tannins and high toast flavors have taken over this wine. The fruit has been submerged. It is difficult to see this completely balancing out.

Situated in the heart of the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this estate has a long history dating back to the Middle Ages. With its stalky black currant fruit and acidity, this is fruity with a cool edge and a crisp edge. Drink from 2018.
wine_name: Château Pey de Faure 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
wine_desc: This wine has an abundance of baked-plum flavor wrapped in smoky char. A full-bodied, ripe expression of the grape, it delivers straightforward structure and an unfussy finish.
wine_name: Foppiano 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

wine_desc: Although 2012 was a ripe, warm year, this wine is tomatoey and herbal. Stalky, salty flavors are barely acceptable.

Massively oaky aromas of spice and clove dominate the nose on this blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Garnacha. It's tannic and burnt on the palate, with little but creosote and clove for flavors. An all-oak finish brings bitterness.
wine_name: Pago Casa Gran 2014 Elegant Casa Benasal Red (Valencia)

wine_desc: Chewing-gum aromas struggle to stay clean and fresh. This rosé feels rubbery and raw. Herbal flavors include juniper berry and finish with almost no fruit.

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: For a plump, medium- to full-bodied wine, this is pungent and citrusy, with lemon and boxwood notes that give the impression of underripeness, despite the labeled alcohol. It's 25% each Clairette, Grenache Blanc and Roussanne, 20% Marsanne and 5% Bourboulenc.
wine_name: Château Beauchêne 2016 Grande Réserve White (Côtes du Rhône)

importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
wine_desc: Light and unfocused, this simple wine has fruit but misses out on structure and much interest.
wine_name: Château Mayne Vieil 2015 Château Buisson Redon  (Bordeaux)

wine_desc: Smoky aromas lead to a wine that is dominated by wood. It is about structure rather than fruit.
Jumpy raspberry and candied plum aromas are akin to Kool-Aid. A rubbery, grabby palate and foxy, medicinal flavors of latex and berry fruits culminate on a strained finish.

appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
wine_desc: While this Tempranillo smells rustic and horsey, it performs better on the palate, which is thick but flat in feel. Rustic, leathery black-fruit flavors finish hot.
wine_name: Venta Morales 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

wine_desc: This magenta-colored blend is mostly Bobal, and it smells reduced, with raw raspberry and plum scents. A racy, rubbery and pinching palate holds tart plum and currant flavors. This wine is constrained as a whole, but juicy.
wine_name: Aranleón 2016 Blés Tinto Organic Wine Red (Valencia)

wine_desc: Aromas of wet cement, spicy oak and generic berry fruits make for a rubbery, earthy whole. This wine is jammy and flabby in feel, with peppery berry and oak spice flavors. It lacks character.
This is a wine that has been spoiled by the over-use of wood aging. The fruit is still struggling to come through. It will be a tough call as to which wins.
It is a tough wine with too much wood for the fruit. Wood aromas show strongly in the taste as well. Some balance will come, but probably not enough.

appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: This heavily oaked Garnacha smells like clove and horsehide. A drawing, scratchy, resiny palate offers clove and barrel-spice flavors. The wine feels tannic and rubbing on a finish that tastes exclusively of oak-based clove.
wine_name: Coto de Hayas 2015 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)

wine_desc: Jumpy, punchy berry aromas are high-toned. This blend feels creamy, candied and syrupy. Sweet flavors of baked fruits and Boston baked beans finish with hints of berry syrup.
wine_name: Earth Wise 2015 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Red (Spain)

wine_desc: Standoffish oak and hot black-cherry aromas are fiery. This nonvintage Mencía is raw and rough on the nose. Woody, resiny flavors sit on top of berry fruit, showing only residual oak on the finish.
wine_name: Bodegas Alanís NV Taurus Enamorado Mencía (Spain)

wine_desc: The wine is tight and perhaps firm. Its extracted tannins and dry core are too much for the fruit.

appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
wine_desc: Sweet and soft, this light-bodied wine tastes faintly like peaches and strawberries, but sugar delivers most of the flavor.

This low-alcohol Basque rosé starts off funky. Pickled, peppery, herbaceous aromas lead to a tart, acidic palate that's not unusual for this style of wine. Sour, herbal, peppery flavors repeat in lighter form on the finish.
This tough wine has overripe fruit. There are tough extracted tannins. It's a hard wine to like.
Mild, melony aromas are friendly, but in the mouth, this wine is sharp and hard-edged, with sizzling acidity. Flavors of tart, underripe peach finish with over-the-top citric acidity.
wine_name: Finca Jakue 2016 Txakolina Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)

appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino/Lake Counties, California, US
wine_desc: A light, bright-coral color and grapey, jammy aromas lead to cherry-jelly flavors and a soft texture for this off-dry wine-in-a-can.
wine_name: Sans Wine Co 2016 Poor Ranch Vineyards Rosé (Mendocino County)

wine_desc: The wine has a southern character with very ripe fruit that seems unbalanced for the tannins and acidity. It's an odd wine.
wine_name: Château de Seguin 2015 Cuvée Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

wine_desc: This is a dry wine, more about structure than fruit. The tannins and the firm extraction shows strongly. It is not enjoyable.

This gold-colorerd wine has fruitless, oaky aromas of squash and pumpkin. It feels flabby, with a resiny oak component to the mouthfeel. Flavors faded if not slightly spoiled white fruits finish with a loud echo of oak.

appellation: Ribera del Duero, Northern Spain, Spain
wine_desc: A cloudy rusted color and soupy aromas render this less than fresh. A chunky, melony palate is low on elegance and acidity, tasting heavily of grape skins.
wine_name: Pradorey 2015 Oak Fermented Rosado (Ribera del Duero)

wine_desc: This is an unfocused wine with fruit flavors that miss the mark. Only the juicy aftertaste is attractive.
The acidity that is a characteristic of the vintage shows through in this wine. It clashes with the tannins to give a strangely unbalanced wine.
Stewy, raisiny and baked on the nose, this wine feels rough and tannic. Soupy, stewed black-fruit flavors finish raisiny.
Candied, grassy aromas set up a dilute palate with green, almost weedy red-fruit flavors. The finish tastes like grape skins, with an animal-like side note.
wine_name: Jardín de Lúculo 2016 Cátulo Organic Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)

wine_desc: Heavy oak aromas of vanilla, marshmallow and milk chocolate dominate the nose, flavor profile and finish on this candied, sticky blend.
wine_name: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Colorea Red (La Mancha)

appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: This comes across as quite sweet and tannic at the same time, with plummy fruit and drying tannins warring on the palate.
wine_name: Ogier 2015 Héritages Élevéen Foundres de Chéne Red (Côtes du Rhône)

appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
wine_desc: This medium-bodied wine displays a distinctive aroma similar to that of bruised apples. On the palate, it's dry and inoffensive, offering up hints of melon and citrus.
The wine is dry, laden with wood flavors rather than fruit. It has a hard over-extracted edge that will stay with the wine as it ages.
wine_name: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2015  Bordeaux

wine_desc: Jabbing red-berry aromas are a bit dusty and yeasty. This wine feels rubbery and astringent. Raw flavors of tomato and herbs finish hard.
Aromas suggest compost, murky grit and olive. In the mouth, this wine is heavy and flat. Roasted, underripe berry-fruit flavors finish hot and gritty.
An undeniable raisiny nose leads to a soupy, flat, raisiny wine that's flawed and barely drinkable.

This blend from individual blocks includes 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Cabernet Franc and 2% Merlot. Juicy and round, it expresses chocolate, vanilla, dark cherry and cassis flavors and is a joy to drink and experience evolve. Despite plenty of ripe power and lushness, it also boasts substantial elegance.

Juicy and seductively smooth, this blockbuster beauty from the revered vineyard site is big, bold and intense, with granular tannins and a grip of integrated French oak. Its bright cassis, lavender, Tahitian vanilla and dried herb flavors are irresistible right out the gate. Ripe and rewarding, it's one to remember.
wine_name: Alpha Omega 2012 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

wine_desc: From another of the grower's impressive, coveted sites, this wine imparts soft, dusty cherry, cassis and pomegranate notes, with a luxurious tease of vanilla and coconut macaroon. Full-bodied and robustly built, it's 100% varietal and barrel-fermented and finishes on a compelling streak of cedar, herb and graphite.
wine_name: Alpha Omega 2012 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

wine_desc: From one of the warmest sites in the grower's stable, this barrel-fermented, 100% varietal wine is beguiling in its complete embrace of ripe, supple sunshine. A grip of oak tannin helps support the exuberant, juicy, dark blue fruit, further defined by its soft texture and underlying, focused acidity.
wine_name: Alpha Omega 2012 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

wine_desc: This bold, broad-shouldered wine shows focused truffle, gravel and cassis flavors. Densely layered, it's 100% varietal, 100% barrel-fermented and further aged in new French oak. With its firm structure, it shows plenty of ability to age and will be best from 2022 through 2023.
wine_name: Alpha Omega 2012 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

wine_desc: This 100% varietal and barrel-fermented wine is a remarkable study in power and grace. Black cherry, cigar box and cedar bark flavors and an invitingly sweet sensation of tannin are supported by bright, lingering acidity and supple complexity.
wine_name: Alpha Omega 2012 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

wine_desc: This 100% varietal, barrel-fermented wine from the hallowed site delivers a grip of tension and balanced weight, providing power within its layers of texture. Earthy and pungent with tobacco and herb scents, it offers leather, cedar and black cherry flavors in equal amounts, finishing with length and grace.
wine_name: Alpha Omega 2012 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This bottling showcases Jim Clendenen's brilliance at making light wines packed with flavor. Rustic sagebrush, oak forest and animal pelt aromas meet red plum and alpine strawberry fruit on the nose. There's a salt and white pepper quality to the palate, where wild sage and more chapparal spice decorates the pomegranate and red plum fruit flavors.
wine_name: Clendenen Family 2013 Le Bon Climat Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: This Chardonnay—one of the best tasted in months—is light in the glass and shows clean, refreshing, yet compellingly rich sea salt, toasted sourdough, key lime and daffodil aromas. Its unique palate blends bright lemon-lime, Asian pear and Marcona almond flavors with a crushed shell minerality that brings the seashore to mind.
wine_name: D'Alfonso-Curran 2013 White Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
wine_desc: The condensed pomegranate aroma on the nose of this bottling from Jim Clendenen is beautifully spiced with star anise, tobacco leaf, dried ginger and cinnamon. The palate shows chai and Indian spice—accents to the cranberry fruit that rides a fine line between ripe and tart. Although light in body, the tannic structure is firm enough to cellar for decades. Drink now–2033.
wine_name: Au Bon Climat 2013 Knox Alexander Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

wine_desc: Peach and tangerine unite to create an utterly seductive nose: luscious juicy flesh is defined by aromatic spice and zestiness. These opposites play off each other and create something that is alive and vigorous, joyful and precious. There is concentration and poise, structure and texture, but none of this concerns the hedonistic forces at play. They just want to express their careless exuberance. There is something defiant about this dry concentrated wine. Perhaps it is a welcome and encouraging counterweight to so much sadness in the world.

Racy and deeply mineral, yet buoyantly fruity, this wine embodies the best from the Mosel's fantastic 2015 vintage. It's lavishly forward in ripe yellow peach, apricot and honeydew flavors, yet bracingly high in acidity. Satisfyingly rich in extract yet feather light, it finishes long, with shards of slate and crushed mineral. Stunning already, it should continue to improve through 2030, likely beyond.

Voluptuously succulent and welcoming, this coastal wine seduces with its caramel apple, pear and preserved lemon flavors, edged with high-toned acidity and an exotic touch of seaspray. That sense of the sea plays out on the palate in texture, too, with a stony note that lingers in nutty spice.
wine_name: Joseph Phelps 2015 Freestone Vineyards Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

wine_desc: Rich layers of honey and nectar roil through this lip-smackingly tropical wine. It's penetrating and juicy, flush with sweet mango, guava and citrus flavors. Cutting lime acidity and mineral intensity jolt the midpalate through an endlessly lingering finish. Stunning already it should improve for decades to come.
wine_name: Robert Weil 2015 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Auslese Riesling (Rheingau)

wine_desc: Pure citrus zest rises from the glass: lovely, ripe lemon and zesty lime. The palate reinforces these flavors in a rapier-like fashion, with drive and energy in a very linear energetic way. This seem like an elixir or a tonic full of vim, all informed by a central dynamic freshness. This has barely blossomed but promises much future pleasure. This genie should be contained in its bottle for a while longer before letting it loose. It's something to look forward to. Drink 2020–2035.

Beeswax and dried chamomile flowers, baked apple and lanolin, lemon rind and a touch of honey: while these aromas are rich on the nose, they become even more bountiful on the palate, filling mouth and mind with their high-wire acrobatics that teeter between steely precision and decadent richness. This late harvest style shows off Riesling's aromatics to great effect. The finish is incredibly zesty and fresh. While this is already evolved, it shows no signs of tiredness and is sure to delight for years to come. Concentration and balance are phenomenal. The haunting aroma of lanolin gets under your skin. Drink now through 2030.
wine_name: Domaine Bernhard & Reibel 2010 Vendanges Tardives Riesling (Alsace)

wine_desc: It's hard to find a favorite within Dr. Loosen's excellent line up of 2015 auslese, but this bottling stands out for its kaleidoscope of fruit, floral and earthen complexities. Sumptuous and ripe, fleshy white peach and grapefruit flavors undulate on the palate. It's finely framed, edged by sharp lines of slate, spine-tingling acidity and swathes of fennel and earth. The finish feels fragile, laced in sweetness and lingering.
wine_name: Dr. Loosen 2015 Erdener Prälat Gold Capsule Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

wine_desc: This bold, beautiful wine benefits from the addition of 14% Merlot from the famous site, as well as smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec. Together they weave a story of smoky power and dusty black fruit, layered with raspberry, black pepper, clove and mocha flavors that linger into the finish.
wine_name: Duckhorn 2013 Three Palms Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

wine_desc: This is the latest vintage from the always impressive long-running joint venture between the Symington family in Portugal and Bordeaux wine consultant Bruno Prats. The wine is elegant and structured with nothing to excess. It has delicious black-currant fruit as well as a core of firm tannins. It is a wine for aging: ripe while so poised. Drink from 2020.

A heady swirl of Amalfi lemon hits you right in the heart, if not the nose. The lemon notes become even more fully expressed on the taut but full, streamlined but expressive and dry body: they take the rich guise of lemon oil and candied peel. They are utterly tart and fresh but with that golden ripeness at their very core that makes this rather seductive. Taste buds just want to get to the bottom of this and rejoice in the purity and fruity tang. This is translucent and refreshing but also rich and full of delicious lemony vigor. The finish is lip-smacking. It will be hard to resist this, but this is certain to get even better. Drink now through 2035.

The nose is still closed and gives away little. The palate has a voluptuous shape but comes tightly corseted: all is present but still closely held. The peachy fruit has a serene easy sweetness that has its perfect counter measure in orange and Meyer lemon freshness. This is poised and sweet but countered and cut by immense freshness. The aromas have yet to unfold fully. Both blood orange and peach lurk promisingly. It is the seamless poised texture of this late harvest that stands out, along with supreme purity. Wait for this. Drink 2020—2035.
wine_name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2015 Clos Jebsal Pinot Gris (Alsace)

wine_desc: The nose suggests utter generosity of ripe juicy pear fruit. The palate enforces this with rounded, aromatic and very pure notes of ripe Bartlett pear.
